It took me from brunch to a beach barbecue to frozen drinks at the pool bar all in one day. It worked with wedges for the start of the day, then swapped to cute sandals for the beach/pool portion. Highly recommend!
This dress is gorgeous, somehow both casual and elegant at the same time. Easy fit because the top is t shirt material.

I felt kind of like the Little Mermaid when she first gets on land and has to wear an old sail, but I loved this! I wore it to work on a more casual day. Lots of compliments. It zips up the side. Where the waist hits and the bow ties is extremely flattering. I am 5'9" and I would describe it as slightly large and long, but the lining under the skirt was a little short. Would wear again!
Dress is beautiful. Received loads of compliments. Only compliant was it wrinkles very easily.
I liked this dress but it wasn't a standout. The length was great and overall fit was ok but I would not rent again

links_reviews_title: Breezy Phillip Lim number ideal for a spring day
links_reviews_text: This dress is darling from the belted waist down -- it feels and drapes like you grabbed a very decent cotton bed sheet and fashioned it into a skirt, not in a bad way. Think Ariel the mermaid when she washes ashore and fashions a ripped sail into a dress. The top half is less interesting -- it's a thick white T-shirt, the end. The sleeves are a bit long and the neck is a bit high -- a slightly more tailored shirt, with a little less coverage, would be cuter, and feel less like the free shirt you got for participating in a 5K. Redeem the skirt portion by hiding the shirt portion; wear it with a cropped jacket and it's a spring winner.

Really loved this piece. White is hard to wear and hard to keep clean but it always is amazing to wear. I wore it with a leather jacket. The T-shirt top was a little right around the chest for me (34C) but with the jacket it wasn't too noticeable. I love the designer's eye for draping and he is always great at flattering a woman's natural shape. Many body types can wear his clothes. My only complaint on this one is that it wrinkled easily where most of his other stuff doesn't. Love love love this look.

links_reviews_title: The dress of my dreams for Spring
links_reviews_text: This dress is great for a pear shape body or tall. Empire waist, not restricting. Slip included not sheer

At 6 feet tall I'm all about the length of this dress! I really loved it. The side zipper is helpful and it was very comfortable. Tightest around the waist where the bow is, the 6 fit me perfect and I'm usually a 6 occasionally a 4 so if you are between sizes I'd size up since you can always sinch it a little tighter using the tie. The stitching on the tie is black in case you can't tell. Make sure you put it on before you do your makeup! White shows everything :)

links_reviews_title: Nice cotton, easy to iron, more a summer dress
links_reviews_text: So even though it's really a warm weather dress I wore it with a cardigan anyway. Almost every other dress I ordered this month was to thin to wear and too prone to static cling... at least this one I could wear. It was cute, comfy and I receive many compliments on it, definitely a flattering style.
I loved this dress! Rented for a cruise and found it comfortable and super cute. It wrinkles easily so just be aware you'll likely have to iron it.
The dress was most likely equivalent to a size 8. I loved the style but couldn't get on.

links_reviews_title: It looked a bit frumpy on my hourglass frame.
links_reviews_text: This just was not flattering on me
Good fit, wrinkled easily

links_reviews_title: T-shirt attached to woven skirt bottom with side zip
links_reviews_text: Liked the light woven material and layered skirt look but the t-shirt is a thick cotton material that is attached to the skirt with a side zip that goes from the top of the skirt into the bottom of the tee. It was difficult to put the top part on without stretching the collar too much.

links_reviews_title: Loved this - and so did everyone else!
links_reviews_text: Fit perfectly.

links_reviews_title: Lovely summer dress. Perfect for a lunch or something where you need to have a crisp, summer look.
links_reviews_text: Fits true to size and the craftsmanship of this dress is excellent
I wore this to an early summer dinner, elementary graduation, mother's day brunch. I got tons of compliments. Loved it. Wish I could have bought it.

This dress is a nice blend of casual or dressy. I wore casually with a sandal but could easily dress up. The tee quality on top is thick and quality. The bottom shirt came a little wrinkled and could use a steam when you receive. The zipper on my 2R was a two person job. It would stick a lot and the dress was not tight on me.

I loved this dress so much and obsessed about wearing it to my daughter's graduation. It was tight in the torso and didn't fit. I'm an apple shape and quite busty. I had the impression the t-shirt top would give, but it had very little stretch. Most size 12's fit me, but I think this is a designer size 12, which seem to run smaller. FYI--The dress has a partial side zipper mid-torso. I think a slimmer person would look great in it. It's sophisticated and understated.
Very conservative dress, the neckline felt. But matronly

links_reviews_title: This fit was a little awkward
links_reviews_text: This was not a flattering fit

links_reviews_title: This has such a beautiful fit
links_reviews_text: Obsessed with this dress. Need to buy it!!
The top fit a little big. I am fairly petite in height and the sleeves looked long. I just rolled them up.
cute idea, but it needed to be more form fitting in order to not look messy on me
Did not wear it as it was stained. Overall a nice dress, though the sleeves are an awkward length and didn't fit me right.

links_reviews_title: Easy to dress up or down
links_reviews_text: A whimsical dress that when paired with heals would be prefect for a gallery opening, when paired with flats or Toms, is great for a casual night out or a luncheon. Fun to wear.

links_reviews_title: A great half-casual half-iconic work or play dress
links_reviews_text: I wore this to work and got more compliments than I ever have. It fit really well on my frame -- I guess I'd be considered closer to athletic than anything else, and this gave me a great shape. It was super comfortable too. No regrets! I'll probably rent it again for the spring.
Has an interesting shape and super comfortable to wear.
The bottom skirt was gorgeous on the hanger but the t-shirt look on top was quite unflattering. I tried it on (with the tag still on) and had to return.
Great dress! Wish it came with instructions for how to wrap it, it wasn't very intuitive for me. Would definitely rent again!
This dress is very comfortable. 4 stars because the sleeves barely hit my wrist & waist could've been tighter.

Loved the style of this wrap dress! It had a great twist detail at the waist that helped cinch you in. The sleeves were fitted and had a cute cuff detail at the wrist. It was slightly shorter than I would like for work, but still ok.

links_reviews_title: Fun and cute! A bit short.
links_reviews_text: Great and unique wrap dress. It is a bit short though (I am 5'10), especially in the back.

links_reviews_title: Great front coverage for a DVF dress but shorter than I expected.
links_reviews_text: When I first put the dress on, I thought it was too short for work. But the addition of tights made it doable and it was cute with booties. The buttons overcome all of the usual cleavage issues with a DVF wrap dress. Loved the cuffed sleeves.
Super comfortable!
Loved the fit. Perfect for my height, and it was slimming.
This dress was so stylish and perfect for day to night! The material was so comfortable to wear all day I would definitely buy this dress or rent again!

I thought the ruching and buttons were flattering, but the sleeves were a little too fitted and didn't roll up, and the length felt a little too short for a work dress that moves and flutters. I also felt like the cut/pattern combo seemed dated somehow. I felt too mature
This dress fit perfectly, lots of compliments!

Perfect for work and customer meetings. Can easily be buttoned up so it's not too revealing. Wasn't too short either, and fairly flattering. Love that it didn't get overly wrinkled In my suitcase. The one thing is it was a tiny bit snug across the chest, but runs fairly true to size.
A tiny bit short for a formal work environment. Wore w a low heel.
Great fit for big chest. DVF never disappoints!

Loved the fit and print of the dress! Sleeves are perfect cuffed. Buttons really helped with the usual wrap dress cleavage issues. Usually wear 4/6, glad I went with the 6! It would be too short/tight otherwise.

links_reviews_title: I got a lot of compliments. The fabric is wonderful
links_reviews_text: It runs a bit small so i went a size up. If you have large breasts use double sided tape to keep the button spacing from creating space. Dress overall is very comfortable
Loved the cut and pattern - cute for desk to drinks. I wore tights because it was a little short for work (and I'm only 5'3) but really liked it. Sexy enough for date night too!
This dress fits so well with buttons on top so your boobs aren't smushed like topical wrap dresses!
I love this dress, it's super comfortable and sexy. I love the animal print and how easy to put on is.
I received so many comments how cute the dress was. It also wraps right at the right place and looks great on!

links_reviews_title: Great dress worn to a movie premier
links_reviews_text: Fit true to size did have a small issue with it untying itself but just make the knot super tight!
Rented for work travel and wore at least three times. Unlimited compliments. I size up in DVF bc I have more muscular arms/shoulders but the wrap waist makes the fit perfect every time. In love!!

When I think sexy I think an outfit that's either way too short or way too revealing or that is going to ride up and leave me struggling on the NYC subway, but this was none of those things. It was sexy, but comfortable and work appropriate (whatever that means) and got me compliments from the moment I walked out the door. DEFINITELY remaining in my rotation for a while to come.
Great dress for work and happy hour! I wore this for a meeting and paired it with a red lip to bring the sass. You can never go wrong with a DVF wrap dress. Bold and chic at the same time!

links_reviews_title: Loved the fabric and pattern. Fun and comfortable!
links_reviews_text: Enjoyed this dress!
Great fit Unlike other DVF wrap dresses because of the buttons it Actually stays closed around the bust!

links_reviews_title: Amazing shape and material hangs so pretty!! Great for any number of events. Want it for keeps!
links_reviews_text: Fit perfectly and flowed so well
This dress is super pretty and flattering with the wrap construction. It does run a little short, so I wore it with opaque tights for work. It would be perfect for a night out! It ran true to size!
This dress fit like a glove. Usually wrap dresses are difficult for me because I am a little busty... the buttons on the top made it perfect! Great pattern. And it's silk. Many compliments !

links_reviews_title: Great print, easy and flattering cut.
links_reviews_text: Loved the wrap. Looked great with tights and boots. Easy. Felt put together. There was a stain the right cuff, and I didn't even notice it until midday. The great print made this no big deal.
Perfect work dress in every way!
I really liked this dress- it was comfortable and fit perfectly. I have a large chest and the wrap did accentuate that a lot so I wore a sweater over it. Would rent again.

links_reviews_title: LOVE this dress and flattering fit!
links_reviews_text: I absolutely loved this dress and will be renting again! As a bustier gal, I was worried about gaps and stretching across the chest, but the 12 fit perfectly and no gaps - a huge win!! Received loads of compliments and was comfortable all night long. Can't wait to wear again!

I really love this dress! Being shaped like Spongebob means I've never had a waist, so wrap styles don't work for me. This one, however, is different. Because the top can be buttoned, I didn't have to wrap it very tightly so I could cheat a shape.

This dress is perfect. The fabric is knit printed silk with some horizontal stretch but no vertical stretch. The print is a really beautiful brown leopard. This photo is before wearing the dress to go out with friends, but I also wore it to work with a black sweater on top and plan to wear it once or twice more before returning. There are so many ways to style this dress. You can button and tie it in a lot of different ways so the fit is very customizable! This dress is a must-rent for sure!
Fun way to wear animal print. Fit great
I had never worn DvF before and thought this was a fun and cute dress. Easy transition from work to a fun night out. The sleeves were long enough for me, yay!
The quality is great.
Wore this to a client meeting and it gave me so much inner confidence! Extremely flattering with a timeless pattern. Would rent again and again, if it was ever available!
Very flattering, great fit, on-trend print. An overall winner! Wore it several times.

links_reviews_title: A different spin on the DvF wrap
links_reviews_text: The buttons on the torso of this wrap dress give it a different look and make it easier to manage in professional settings. To those who claim this is cotton, please note it is 100% silk jersey and feels great. This dress has a way of emphasizing your curves and therefore may be more flattering for straight figures as opposed to hourglass like me. Even though it wasn't super flattering on me and more of a mini-dress than I like, I wore it 3 times, to work, a conference, and dinner.

links_reviews_title: Worn to work with high jeans and to brunch. Fun shirt!

links_reviews_text: I got this for a weekend trip to NYC, wanted to have something casual for walking around the city. The medium was the perfect size for me. It's very cropped which is what I was looking for, I wore with high rise jeans

I knew this was a crop top when I ordered it, but it's a little more cropped than I expected. Especially considering I'm only 5'3". I intentionally wore a high waisted skirt and pulled it well past my bellybutton. I still couldn't raise my arms without showing above my skirt and under boob. I thought about sizing up to a medium, but I didn't want to get lost in the shirt since it is boxy. Not my favorite rental.
This darling shirt was such a fun rental and pop of color! Paired with my high waisted DVF pants, it was the perfect work outfit.
Wore to work with high waisted pants (also rented). It's fine when you're standing still or sitting, but does rise when you move around. No dress code at my office. Would rent again for the weekend
Rented for every day wear and it was great. My only con would be that the material is heavier than expected and it was an unusually warm day in the spring causing me to sweat in this.
Cute and vibrant!

links_reviews_title: Wore for work and weekend wear
links_reviews_text: Love this shirt! Great color and the high/low length is very cute with high waisted pants. I wore it with paper bag black dress pants and jeans, both looked great! Got a ton of compliments and will definitely rent again!

links_reviews_title: really cute with pencil skirt for work or high waisted jeans for going out
links_reviews_text: careful zipping up the back easily catches your hair
Cute top. Fit well. Liked it and would rent again :)

links_reviews_title: Great top! Super cute with high waisted jeans
links_reviews_text: Cute top

I wore this shirt to work functions with a tank or long-sleeved shirt under it, as well as on its own with jeans. It's a boxy cut, so it's a bit tough to tell if the Large ran a little big (the back was very baggy) or not. Pear-shaped & short-waisted folks like myself might find that it masks the narrowest part of your waist a bit, but I loved it anyway.

links_reviews_title: Super cute, love the pop of color. It is quite cropped.
links_reviews_text: It fit well overall, BUT it is definitely short. Even with high rise pants, as soon as you lift your arms, it is up to your chest. I wore a black tank top under it with black jeans, and it worked just fine. I am 5'9", but still something to note.

links_reviews_title: Super cute and not too short
links_reviews_text: The length of the crop was great because it hit right at the top of my high-waisted jeans, so I didnt feel exposed but still got a cute crop effect. Loved the color and the fabric is fairly soft.
Loved how vibrant this shirt was! I wore it out bar hopping and it was perfect. It totally dressed up my jeans! The zipper in the back adds cute detail too.

Fun little crop top, perfect with a pencil skirt or high rise jeans. Fits true to size, with a fun back zip and a great saturated color. The buttons on the shoulders add interest, but I didn't think they went with the top necessarily... worth a rent!

This shirt was so cute and I received so many compliments about my outfit that day (worn with a black and white striped skirt)! My only note would be that for ladies with larger chests like myself, it required high-waisted bottoms.

Great quality with a proper zippering the back. Loved the color too. I only wore it once as I looked a little boxy with a bigger chest and that neckline but would recommend for other body types like athletic, straight, etc

links_reviews_title: Too boxy for a short torso
links_reviews_text: Amazing color. Cute design. Made my short frame with big boobs look like a box.
very short!
Cropped cute top with even better back button detail. Shoulder and back details make this a fun top. Thick material make it season versatile
Wish the medium had been available but the large was fine. I had the small once and it was just a little snug. Cute shirt for going out or whatever.
Loved this top. The color is striking and it's beautifully made. It was shorter than I expected, but it still worked out great.
Too short for high waisted and crop top look. I'm 5'10", so maybe that's the issue.
Love the fabric, such a beautiful piece

links_reviews_title: LOVED IT! I'm petite and it fit perfect
links_reviews_text: Fit perfect for my petite frame.

This fit true to size, was great quality (thick fabric without being too heavy), and I loved the color - it's a true vibrant pink like the photo shows. I have a short torso and didn't feel like it was cropped up too far - just a slight crop which is what I was looking for. I ultimately didn't wear it because I decided on another top to bring with me on vacation instead, but I will most likely rent this again in the future.

links_reviews_title: 5 stars even tho did not wear
links_reviews_text: This was beautiful and the crop is really nice. The only reason I did not wear it is that the neckline was not flattering on me. This is totally a personal thing though and not something most people should concern themselves with. I have a very thin neck and sometimes you can see my veins. Certain necklines seem to accentuate this if they fall in a particular path. the color is gorgeous. there is a surprising amount of stretch even though it appears as a non-stretch woven material. totally recommend especially for smaller chest ladies.
These fit so cute and I loved them!
The high waisted buttons made me feel secure and the ruffles add the best touch. Not see through! A must!!!
Madewell jeans are the G.O.A.T. - that is all.
Love the jeans, they hold everything in and look sharp with heels and sneakers. Dresses up a casual look. Wearing it with RTR Carven Blue Patch Mini Jacket. One of many outfits!
Trying on new brands of jeans is usually nerve wracking for me because I never know how far up I'll get them, but these slid right on and felt so good! They looked so flattering too!

links_reviews_title: Comfy not as flattering as I wanted
links_reviews_text: Very comfortable however it was not as flattering to my behind as I would have preferred

I want to buy these so bad! And still might! The fit was perfect and so flattering. Loved the height of the rise. The jeans are thick enough where they aren't see through, yet have a stretch and are so soft and comfortable.
Really cute jeans, but ran big in the waist. Fit great in the thigh and didn't stretch out there, but did stretch in the waist as the day wore on.
Loved these but they did start to stretch once I wore them for the entire day. I tried to wear them the second day and because of how much they stretched I couldn't. Maybe size down
Put them on and bought them right away. They are a little long for the fringe at 5 1 but otherwise absolutely perfect.
Wore this when friends came over for dinner. Cute and comfortable! Will rent again.
I have never worn high rise jeans before so I was a little nervous. I loved them! The fabric has nice stretch and extremely comfortable. Something I might consider buying later.

links_reviews_title: Amazing jeans. Nice amount of stretch, not seethrough, super flattering and dare I say comfortable?
links_reviews_text: These are the best white jeans I've tried. Love the high waist and button fly. They are thick enough to not be seethrough (I accidentally wore with dark grey undies one day and you couldn't tell). They have stretch but didn't get baggy by the end of the day. I'm keeping them for another month and kind of wish I owned them.
Big around waist and too tight around calfs
Super comfortable and veryyyy high rise. I rally liked these ones but they run a size big so size Down
The material is really soft and flattering. Sadly I ordered a size up and they were way too big to wear. Would rent again in my regular size or even a size down.

links_reviews_title: Cute pants but the black in same style blew the white out of the water
links_reviews_text: These white pants were not near as comfortable or flattering as the black. The fabric did not have as much give, and the fit was just not as perfect. The black pants had just enough stretch and were so comfortable. These did not have enough give in the waistband and fit much more like actual denim. Still very cute pants! But they were not worth keeping to wear and tying up one of my spots.
I should've gone down a size since these have a bit of stretch to them! Otherwise, they're adorable and comfy!
These are an excellent pair of white jeans. Enough stretch to make curves look good but never sags. I'm buying!

The first time I rented these I went up to a 29 (sometimes high waists on my curves need a little more room!) but those were HUGE. I could literally take them off without unbuttoning them. I have the 28 this time and they're much better, maybe even still large. I'm hanging in to these a while- thick, cut ankle detail, love the button fly

I love these jeans. I've had them for about a month now and am considering buying them. They are trendy with the buttons and some fraying at the ankles. They are also the perfect length and waist height (I am 5'3") - not too short, not too long. The material is thick but has a nice stretch to it.

They are stretchy so it's possible you could Size down. By the end of the day they stretched and became looser on me so I definitely needed a belt. Cute jeans, but not as flattering as other pairs of madewell jeans I've had.

links_reviews_title: LOVED! But they grow during the day....
links_reviews_text: I've been dying to rent these. Rented my normal size (28) in j crew jeans since these companies are related. They fit when I first put them on but grew during the day and felt too big. I would size down if you can! Really cute. If I can get the size smaller, I will probably buy them. They're great!
Cute style. Love high rise. I needed a 28 tho. They were baggy.
Comfortable fit

I usually wear a size 30 in pants but sized down to 29 because these are stretchy. Fit well and might rent again. Only complaint is that these felt and sounded a little squeaky when my legs rubbed together!
i'm short so the length was right above my shoe but these jeans fit perfectly!
I didn't love these jeans. I like my jeans to fit tight, and these were just too big and the material was too thick. I probably needed the next size down.
Very comfortable and flattering
I am larger in hips/butt and these fit snug enough to stay up but could have used smaller waist. I normally wear a size 4 but went up a size with the high waisted jeans to be safe

This fun -colored jacket fits true to size, not oversized. Fits nice to the body. Only cons: it is not warm at all. Too cold to wear in San Francisco at 54F (windy). Wind goes through it easily and it has thin silk lining. Got complements from my bestie:)

links_reviews_title: Great soft Teddy Bear warmth and color
links_reviews_text: This coat was comfortable and warm. Only reason I didn't give it 5 stars was that the buttons often came undone. The color looked great with my purple purse.

links_reviews_title: Adorable addition to my coat rotation!
links_reviews_text: This teddy bear coat is beautiful. I'm 5'4" inches and it hits right at my knees. Perfect to wear a few times a week to work or over my workout outfit to the gym. An XS wouldve been a better fit considering how oversized it is but the small is fine! Warm enough to wear in 40 degree weather but nothing colder than that.

links_reviews_title: This coat is huge and I sized down
links_reviews_text: I wear 4/6 and medium. I rented a small and it was still huge. Size down twice if you want it to fit.

Really cute lavender oversized coat. Nice weight to keep you warm. Big & furry. I would've preferred a sz M but made the L work. This coat was one of the better quality ones than the other fluffy coats that I've tried. Would rent again.
Literally wore this coat everyday. It's perfect. Warmer than she looks. Beautiful color.

Ordered the small but XS would of been perfect which wasn't available. I've never had a teddy fabric jacket before. And I really wanted to try one for a New England snowstorm to check if it was warm enough. Which it was, so I kept it for a few days. Would recommend.

Rented for fall trip to London and Paris and it kept me toasty warm the whole time! Went a full size down and it fit perfectly. My husband initially called it my cat lady coat but we saw so many similar coats walking around Paris that he finally had to admit it was fashionable! It is fluffy and oversized and makes a statement but I totally loved it!!
Fits very large and looks a bit like a bathrobe. Very soft and comfortable though.

links_reviews_title: The best fuzzy jacket that's warm and has great pockets.
links_reviews_text: Fit was oversized but overly so. Pockets are placed perfectly. Love the muted purple color.
Loved the color and the coziness!
This coat was really cute to spice up my winter wardrobe. It does run rather large.

links_reviews_title: Beautiful coat, but couldn't really wear it oversized.
links_reviews_text: Order a size down! The medium swallowed me whole.
This jacket is an awesome piece to change up your outerwear wardrobe. Super cozy, warm and oversized. Perfect for layers on top of a sweater!

I was so wary of getting this one but I'm soooo glad I did. It is the cutest dang coat ever! Sherpas are way in this season, but the color makes this one stand out. The most perfect Lavender hue. I get compliments on it every single day(no lie) and I think I may just buy it lol Fits how it should and I've been surviving an NYC winter in it, so it's very warm.

links_reviews_title: So good I had to buy it!
links_reviews_text: I wanted this in a small but took a chance on the medium since it was the only size available. I think this coat would look great on you in your size and the next size up depending on the fit you prefer. The size up looks very trendy and cozy

Definitely makes a statement. I got a couple comments from people because it’s not every day you see a big fluffy purple coat. It seemed to me that the wind might blow through it so I don’t know if I’d recommend it for extreme cold weather. I’m in Virginia and this coat is probably warm enough for most winter days where I live.

links_reviews_title: OK, would need to size down
links_reviews_text: It's pretty enough but a bit blah - I'd say size down one or two to get a more tailored and chic look

I love the color and texture but this was too large for me to wear. I ordered a Small but should have ordered a XS. Even so, I still think the sleeves and coat length would have been too long on me. Would look great on someone taller.
I love this coat! It kept me warm on chilly November mornings/evenings, and it was so comfortable. I loved the color, too, I got tons of compliments.
Loved the colour but it runs so large, size down a couple sizes.
This blouse is so pretty in person. I could definitely see myself renting this again!
Great blouse for everyday or dressing up. Full sleeves pop! Distinctive, darling, and frequent complements
The print is beautiful, the fabric is soft but a bit noisy. The sleeve are also much bigger than I had anticipated. I loved this top and would wear it again.

This is an excellent poplin top that draws the line between being over exaggerated. If you're petite the sleeves look a lot puffier than on the model. Quality is A+. The v neck is slightly lower than expected which makes it questionably work appropriate if it's not tied. Picked a size 4 but easily could have sized down.
Favorite top I've gotten from RTR.
If you like big sleeves and a boxy top, this shirt is for you. It's a lot of material but paired with UJ high-waisted jeans, it works. Very crisp cotton - a nice fabric for the summer.
i love this top. wore it to a party and dinner with friends.
I love this top and got so many compliments when I wore it. My only complaint is the awkward length. I wish it was about 2 or 3 inches longer. At the length it is, it almost HAS to be tucked in.
True to size and fits as you'd expect. I got a bit of wear out of this in August and feel like it could go into fall with jeans.
Great print. Puff sleeves. Nice fall transition top.

links_reviews_title: Fun, 70's vibe. Size down for a firmer fit
links_reviews_text: A perfect balance of casual but chic. Got a ton of compliments at work. However they did get loose throughout the day. You can see in the photo, they lost their snugness around the front waist/hip area. I'll return and try get a size down cause they were great to wear!

links_reviews_title: Nice fabric and cut but runs big
links_reviews_text: Not great on me
Comfy, high waisted. Great for just having another cute option for pants to wear. I received compliments every time I wore them!

links_reviews_title: I found them hard to style
links_reviews_text: Now, they fit like a dream, true to size, hugged all the right places, comfortable, not tight anywhere, however, i found them super hard to style and that could just be because of my build. They are super super high waisted and nothing i tucked in or wore over looked right - ended up with what u see here for a wearable look!! Don't hesitate because of fit!!!

These pants are hands down my favorite rental. Perfect for winter, the velvet corduroy elevated the navy pants to statement piece status. The waist is high, but the button fly is cute with tucked in sweaters. So cozy. Rent these!
I'm normally an 6 or 8 and they didn't have the 6 in stock so I went w the 8 but they were massive. I could've even done the 4. Size down! Would rent again in smaller size. Very 70s chic
Wish they had been thicker and longer but they were cute and got lots of compliments!

links_reviews_title: Loved the fit as it hugged my curves very well.
links_reviews_text: I really liked how high waisted and comfortable the fit was. It felt great wearing. I also received many complements for the style of pant
Rented size 0. I'm a true 25 in jeans and these ran more like a 26. Wearable and looked cute but felt big.
Absolutely love these pants -- they fit perfectly! Great, thicker material for late fall / winter. Slightly cropped and look great with booties.

Wide wale corduroy, so super comfortable. Color is a nice navy, definitely reads as blue not black. Easy to style because of the color. I would say true to size (I wear 27 denim, wore these in a 4); if anything, they gapped a little in the back of the waist. If you're hourglass, definitely TTS. If you're straighter through the torso, waist could get a little snug, as it is very high.

links_reviews_title: I could live in these pants
links_reviews_text: These are the most amazing pants I've ever worn I wish I could buy them! I get so many compliments and I feel like they instantly make you look stylish. It looks good with white, black, or even print tops. Very versatile! I am in between sizes (5'6, 115 pounds) and ordered up to a 2. They ended up stretching a bit but I didn't mind the baggier look for these pants.
A little baggy at the crotch
Sad to see such low ratings on this. I absolutely loved these pants! Definitely size up as they run small, but other than that, it works. They stretch out a bit as you wear them too.
I love these. A little stretchy and high waisted - true to size! My only complaint is sometimes the buttons come undone (has a button fly, no zipper.) Even with that these are worth the rent!

links_reviews_title: SO cute, if I never sit down
links_reviews_text: These were soft and comfortable, flattering, and I love the high button detail. They come up VERY high, even for high-waisted pants. But there is no elasticity at the waist at all, which made it really uncomfortable to sit for much time. :(

I loved these high rise cords. They had a 70s look to them that I really loved. They were comfortable and easy to wear. I feel like they are true to size or maybe even a little bit large? But I'm between a 0 and a 2, and these weren't tight. Very comfortable, very cute. If they're still around in fall (it's really too warm in TN to wear them now), I'd rent them again (and maybe buy them)!
Some of the favorite pants I've worn. They were a little snug but very very flattering.
High waist crop. Great blue color. Plus they have some stretch so they were super comfortable!

links_reviews_title: Not flattering if you have hips (which most of us do)
links_reviews_text: The material was thicker than I thought. That, combined with the high waisted design made me look huge. Did not wear.
Has a nice stretch and is really comfortable/ soft. It fits in the thighs nicely but very loose around my waist. Stretched out throughout the day as well.

links_reviews_title: Who knew corduroy would be so cool?
links_reviews_text: Loved the silhouette of these pants. Great high waist, beautiful color, great cut. Perfect everyday elevated pant.

These are freakin fabulous. They fit perfectly, do not hesitate to rent these. I do have a very long torso so the only thing I can say is maybe if you have a short torso might be too high waisted. Favorite pants hands down I've rented so far.

These were interesting cords - the color is rich, the high-waisted cut will be flattering on many people. These were good, but not good enough on me to wear. Something about the high waist and the ankle length didn't jive with me. Definitely worth a try, though, especially if you're looking to spice up weekend wear, or work in a casual environment.
Fit like a glove!
Super cute and flattering fit!

links_reviews_title: Loved the fit and they're so flattering!
links_reviews_text: Everything about these pants are amazing! I loved the high waistline! Rent!

links_reviews_title: This runs a little big - I rented a size 4 (I am 5'4", 115 lbs) and it was too big.
links_reviews_text: Very nice quality

These pants were super comfortable. If they were less expensive, I would buy them just for the comfort factor alone. I received many compliments on them at work as well. The only thing I didn't love was the face that they ran 1/2 - 1 full size too big. Normally I like high waisted pants, but with the extra room throughout the waist, they felt a little frumpy. Also, I have larger calves and these weren't loose enough to fit perfectly. Overall, cute but not for me.

links_reviews_title: The pants are super cute but the waist is so tight it would not be comfortable for a whole day
links_reviews_text: way too tight in the waist
These are so cute and different. I was surprised by how bright the blue was and how raised the corduroy was. Got lots of compliments.

links_reviews_title: Cute on the model, but waaaay too big
links_reviews_text: I was really excited to wear these pants because high-waisted corduroy is my favorite fall style. However, these pants were way too big around the waist. I could fit both my arms inside the pants when they were zipped up and there was room for more. I usually only wear high-waisted pants because I find that they are the only pant style that fits me around the waist (I’m pretty tall and have an athletic build.) These pants were a big exception to that. I don’t think I’d recommend sizing down though because they seemed to fit fine around the legs. All in all, I just think the proportions of these pants are off.

links_reviews_title: Cool way to change up my wardrobe
links_reviews_text: The pants fit as described and even had a bit of stretch to them.

I have never received as many compliments on an outfit at work than I did when I wore these! They are so cute and stylish. I am 5'4" and the length was great on me. My husband wanted me to buy them even knowing much they would cost :). They did stretch throughout the day so I would say they run a little big and maybe size down to prepare for the stretch.

I didn't wear this. Maybe if it was cool and dry outside it'd have been ok but it's hot and humid here so the tightness of the sleeves on my arms was uncomfortable. Plus the shirt connects in the back? Cool I guess but also weird. Not good for leaning over my desk all day.
There is a belt in the back that took me a second to figure out

links_reviews_title: Really cute but too small for my bust.
links_reviews_text: It was too small for my bust.

links_reviews_title: Cute, everyday shirt with a twist
links_reviews_text: This shirt is a classic blue blouse with a little something extra. The back detail is subtle but really fun. The pearl detail on the sleeve is almost hidden between your arm and side, so subtle.
It just wasn't terribly exciting on. A good basic shirt if you were looking for that
Good fit
love the fit and style
Too tight in the bust and arms. It had cute details and I'm bummed it didn't work, but beware if you're even remotely busty or have toned arms.
The pro of this shirt is the detail in the back and the sleeves. The front is not very shapely. Also, the shirt material is quite wrinkly. Overall, I would rent again for the back detail.
Loved the fit, pearl details on the sleeves!

links_reviews_title: Pretty blue and lovely pearl details
links_reviews_text: Pros: Long length Pearl button details Color Roomy fit Extra strap around back that pulls in waist line Better on than expected Cons: Wrinkles easily Puffy sleeves weren't flattering on me
Great shirt it was just missing a button on the right hand side

links_reviews_title: Love this shirt - I got a larger size knowing that this brand runs small. I am 5'6" 138lbs.
links_reviews_text: Very comfortable fit
It's cute but the arms are too tight and uncomfortable. I have what I consider fat arms.

links_reviews_title: Perfect for a professional cocktail party!
links_reviews_text: I wore it tucked into high-waisted belted cropped pants with black high pumps:)
Rare case of photo looking slightly better than reality. Weird fitting makes your shoulders look more Football Player than elegant. Super comfy but won't rent again.

Pleated fabric on shoulders adds a lot of volume & the illusion of shoulder pads. Gave me an early '80's vibe, yup I'm old enough to remember! Pros: I liked the neck and overall length, and discovered you can fold up the cuffs and they'll stay folded, should you want to wear them that way. Cons: somewhat sheer fabric, side slits come up higher than I expected, wrinkles from sitting. Runs a smidge large in the shoulders; mine are narrow, so that plus the pleats made it a bit much. One and done.

Good top, very flattering, and nice coverage of arm flab and aged decolletage, for those of us over 50. Also has some style and shape and a nice lining. Kind of brings back the feel of shoulder pads, which was ok for me, since I have no shoulders. But be aware there is some pouff.

If you're looking for a basic black blouse with a high neckline that's not see theu, this is a good one. Didn't end up wearing it bc I wore something else but it was as I expected it to be and got true to size.
This ran HUGE. I ordered my normal size and it was big all over. I think it's supposed to have SOME volume but I recommend sizing down.
This shirt was cute and is great if you need a plain black shirt. I found that I had cuter things in my closet that I wore instead, so I only wore this once.
I loved wearing this blouse. Looks more flattering in person. I wore it with jeans for work But could easily dress it up. I wish I could keep it!

I am a smaller person but I felt this shirt was way too big, even for an extra small. The sleeves were way too baggy and perhaps if my arms had been longer it would have filled them out a little more. I really liked the neckline and if the sleeves had fit better it would have been a win.Did not wear.

Nice, well-made shirt, but I have wider shoulders and long arms. The cuffs were constricting and the gathered neckline wasn't flattering. If you are more narrow and don't have long arms, would be great for work.
So flattering and comfortable, this top is sure to make you feel and look great!
Really can go with almost anything!! A little puffier than I expected in the arms and shoulders, but overall great!!
Nice for everyday. I liked the neckline and details at wrist. Nothing super special, though, and a bit sheer, so I preferred a cami underneath.
This did absolutely nothing for me. It felt short on the sides and long in the back. I think you need to be very tall and thin to make this work.
Cute
Really versatile blouse that can go from formal to casual with jeans. Comfortable and put-together; a roomy fit and fits well on a larger bust even in a small. Will probably rent again!
The shoulders are a bit too puffed up.

links_reviews_title: First time using rent the runway unlimited and chose an outfit for holiday shopping.
links_reviews_text: I needed to lay down to button these up, but they looked great. I would suggest to size up. Great light gray color.

Haven't worn this style of jeans before with buttons up front. I think this style accentuates my fanny pack. The denim straight leg needed to be a bit more fitted. There is no stretch to these which most jeans nowadays are. Wore only one time.
These pants were awesome! Not much stretch in the legs and I'm glad I ordered one size bigger.
Really good Jean material. Great quality. Looks good with everything. Comfortable fit. Runs a bit big. Has a good stretch

These were fun for a day and look best when you first put them on. They are traditional jean material so they stretch out a bit. I liked the button fly, but it looked less cute when the jeans stretched out a bit. If you can handle it comfort wise, I would recommend sizing down to account for the fabric stretch.

I rented these jeans for a horseback trip through Montana. The jeans are thick and sturdy, but stretch out easily as the day goes on and never really bounce back. I'm usually a 25 or 26 in jeans, but these 26s were pretty large. Great light grey color and perfect high waist
Great summer jean! The high waist is at your true waist, the button fly is super cute, and the not too skinny fit was perfect for warmer weather. Will probably rent these again
Perfectly fitted jeans. Love how high waisted they are and where they hit on the waist. The wash was also great for summer!
cute but stiff denim
Comfortable jeans. Shorter ankle cut. Loved the buttons. Seemed to be a little stretched out from wear. Almost decided to buy these if not for how stretched out they were
Cute and stylish!

I thought these ran super small. I could barely button them, let alone try to sit down. Maybe it's because I have a super straight figure (nice way of saying wide waist). So they fit everywhere except the waist. Also the bottom button was coming off, so it made it hard to button. These have zero stretch. I was super looking forward to these, disappointed. Also, I thought they were light gray, but they're a very light blue denim color.
Couldn't get the first button done! I love the wash and button fly - just wish they fit.

Fit was tight at first, but the jeans stretch out as the day goes on, making for a perfect fit after a couple of hours. I loved them, comfortable and trendy- high waisted with buttons. My husband did not think they were the most flattering on me though, said they made my but look large, so I returned after a few wearings.
Just love to wear these jeans. Days that I'm not wearing them, I wish I were!

links_reviews_title: Great button fly jean with fresh grey color
links_reviews_text: This jean is a fresh, bright grey. I've worn these jeans obsessively since I got them - they pair with virtually anything and look especially nice with the Rag & Bone Navy/Grey Hannah Chevron shirt I rented with it. I generally wear a 29 in jeans, but that size wasn't available - COH jeans tend to be a little roomier on me, so I took a risk and got the size down that was in stock - and they fit perfectly. The exposed button fly does wonders for keeping my stomach supported.
Loved the high-waisted jean, fun ankle cut, fit very well even for someone with a little booty and hips.
Super comfortable and have a nice stretch to keep everything looking tight and in place. Easy to unbotton top button for when you eat too much pasta.
Cute style, but size up since there is no stretch at all.
Started to do RTR unlimited after having my second baby. These are fun jeans that hide the mom-weight and make me feel cool! FYI the buttons really suck for going to the bathroom...
Super cute but didn't fit. No stretch!
Baggy in the crotch. Not as cute as I was hoping.
Was expecting more from these jeans. Never tried this brand. I typically stick to Paige and Madewell and have no problem in size 27/28 and I couldn't even get these up. Super disappointed all around.

links_reviews_title: Did not wear the jeans unfortunately
links_reviews_text: These were incredibly tight, and not as high rise as anticipated
didn't love them. stretch out too quickly. by the end of the day they wouldn't stay up. size down.
Got suggested size & other items of the same size fit great. Could not even get these on. Too small!
Loved the high waist. It was a bit tight on my tummy, but I loved these pants.

I love these, but i definitely should have gotten a 25R or 26R. I always rent jeans at a larger size than I think I wear as so many designers make their jeans run small. I'd say these are probably true to size if I had ordered the size I think I wear. I loved the high waist and buttons up the front. I got so many compliments. If I had ordered the correct size, I would have purchased.

links_reviews_title: LOVE these. until they stretch out, which happened after one wear.
links_reviews_text: Almost bought them - love the style but they stretch out like crazy. They started off tight and were literally falling off of me the second time I tried to wear them.

links_reviews_title: Love the high waist aspect which is why I rented it but the waist was much larger than the legs.
links_reviews_text: Fits true to sizein the butt and legs... except the waist was HUGE! So thats why I only wore it once.
They seemed a bit tight in the waist but the rest fit well.

sigh. such a perfect color and waist length. i love exposed button flys so much i wish so hard these fit better. This seems to happen to me a lot with high waist even though my natural waist measurement is 26 and i have muscular thighs and a round butt, 24s are big on me in most big brands unfortunately. I still wore them. I just didn't wear them in a way where I was trying to show off my body.
Not a lot of stretch, so order your actual size. And VERY high waist, love the exposed buttons.
Ran a little large, not as cute or flattering a fit as I'd expected
I rented these jeans in my typical size but they were hard to get over my hips so I sent them back without wearing

links_reviews_title: Large waist with cute half belt
links_reviews_text: The jeans are super cute but didn't fit my hour glass figure. They are long waisted with enlarged waist above the belt.

Effortlessly cool denim that does all the work for you. I went with my true size and thought the fit was great, I loved that the back pockets are oversized slightly. The top waist is meant to be loose, so keep in mind the belt is not meant to be so taught that it acts like a real belt. It is functional and can be adjusted but is creating a cool girl jean that can be paired back to night out top or sweater. Loved!
Ordered these for WFH because being have many jeans. Cute and comfortable. Love them! Belt does fall at an odd spot but not a deal breaker.

links_reviews_title: Way to big on the legs and tight on stomach - bad fit for me and no stretch whatsoever .
links_reviews_text: Normally wear a 28 comfortable and 27 tight. These are not great
I think these fit true to size. Many reviews say small but I'm a healthy 4 and they fit great.

Seems like people don't think rag and bone fits tts, I think it 100% does. I love these, I got a size. 4 could fit in the 2 but I like a little room to move around. I'm going to buy these. Not a lot of stretch which i prefer.
These pants are super flattering and chic, very happy with them. Want to keep!
Fit is great. Great for hiding a bit of a pooch while still being a flattering high waist.
Cute jeans, but not the right fit for my body.
Not a great fit, not much stretch. The photo on the model makes it them looked cropped
Nothing particularly fancy, but they did fit well and were a nice quality denim. Given my height, they were definitely cropped on me. Black dye came off on my hands all day when I wore them.
Too small. Same size in other jeans fit fine.

links_reviews_title: This has no stretch like other rag and bone jeans

links_reviews_text: nice fabric, great color. Too small, did not wear

The jeans were just what I wanted them to be except there is little to no stretch so they were too tight in the thighs for me. I typically wear a 27 in pants but have athletic legs and butt. Would have been a great fit otherwise. If you have a bubble butt and or athletic legs size up.
Seems like they don't have a lot of stretch but they definitely loosen quickly as you wear them. True straight leg jeans. Waist hits just above the belly button (I'm 5'6).

links_reviews_title: Fits like a glove, but doesn't retain shape well
links_reviews_text: This fit great when I put them on but they do have stretch so over time I ended up needing a belt to wear them. I would recommend sizing down if you're between sizes because of how stretchy these are.

These are very nice jeans. I loved wearing them. I should have sized up to a 26, they were a little tight around my thighs but still fit fairly well. The color is a very dark blue-black that I thought looked great with grays.
These looked great and I was super excited to wear them but they have no stretch for us ladies with a booty or thighs. Size up. I will try renting again in a larger size.
Fit like a glove. Comfortable. Awesome quality. Happy with length. Matched with everything. I only wish I kept them longer!

links_reviews_title: Very restricted denim, plus runs small. I will probably try to rerent again, one size up.
links_reviews_text: I'm 5'11 and this is a great ankle length for me. Tight in the thighs.
It was recommended that I size down, but I really could've sized up. These jeans do not have much stretch, so if you have big thighs will not fit...
Size 28 fit me comfortably, and appropriate for work. I would rent a 27 next time for the tighter look for everyday wear. I was expecting the length to look shorter above my ankles.
Unfortunately they were too small for me...one more size up and they would have fit.

links_reviews_title: Loved how comfortable these jeans wore. I wore it with a cute off the shoulder, bell sleeved, top.
links_reviews_text: Thank you.
Too small in waistline—would order size up
I really liked these, but they were too small. I'd like to reorder and size up.

links_reviews_title: ran true to size and very comfortable
links_reviews_text: loved them! would rent again.

links_reviews_title: These pants are a strange length they hit above my ankle.
links_reviews_text: Too short.
Great overall! High rise which is great, and the fabric is relatively thick (which is not that good). Wore it twice. Overall, a good basic.

links_reviews_title: Cute, but not the right fit.
links_reviews_text: Ignored the reviews about lack of stretchy-ness and shouldn't have. A bit snug in the hips and didn't quite hit right in the ankles.

Maybe it's just me but I I rented these jeans in a size 26 & 27. The 27's fit but looked awful on me. I tried different tops and shoes and nothing looked good, so I blame the jeans. Sorry but these are a no go
runs small
Loved these- they fit me longer than the picture as I am only 5'5, but I felt they still were comfortable and flattering. Hit around ankle.
I wore these but they were just OK. Nothing special about them.

links_reviews_title: Great jeans but not for the shorter gals.
links_reviews_text: These are great quality denim, true black and fit true to size BUT if you're only 5'4" like me, they will be bootleg cut jeans, as the flare will hit at the ankles, not so flattering...
The 28 in this style was completely different than the 28 in the Grey High Rise Skinny, so they didn't fit. Bummer!
Very flattering & different than my usual skinny jeans
These are really nice pants, just unfortunately they are too small. There is no stretch to them, so even though I ordered my normal size, I couldn't wear them. I'd size up if you rent these.
Didn't wear
Okay fit, didn't blow me away, but solid

links_reviews_title: Pants were not stretchy and way too small
links_reviews_text: So tight and I usually am a 28

links_reviews_title: Not a great fit for petite
links_reviews_text: I'm 5'1 so I tend to struggle finding the right size for different brands. This size 27 was too big and wide from the knee down. But the waist rested perfectly as stated. I'll try a size down and see if that might be a better fit.

Cozy WFH pants. They didn't look like true joggers but were more form fitting. The L fit me fine but weren't really loose. They were also well made so when I wore them outside, I was still warm even on a cold and breezy day! Considered keeping them.

links_reviews_title: Cozy on the bottom for WFH. Love how soft and smooth the velour is. Ran a bit tighter fitting
links_reviews_text: Cozy and warm to sit in all day. They are cropped but length was fine for me (5'4). Definitely rent if you want new sweats!
Looks like a Capri if you're taller. Such a soft material and could be really cute, but just wayyyy too short. If you're 5'9+ Skip it.
Sized up and was glad I did. They are super soft but very fitted. Good everyday option.

links_reviews_title: everyday sweats made comfy and chic!
links_reviews_text: Soft and comfy chic. Love how it hugs the buttocks, hip and waist. Luxury casual chic.

Currently OB-SESSED with velvet/velour, so I was excited when these were available in my size. These pants are so comfortable, I now keep my eye out for Fila apparel when it becomes available. These are very true to size and fit almost like a legging. tl;dr: RENT THESE.

Everything about these is perfect - the cut, the velvet, they are super soft. I sized up because the L was the only size available but am glad I did. It helped keep the jogger shape - a M would be more form fitting and I think the jogger shape would have been lost.
True to size. Very soft and cozy!
Loved these pants. Didn't want to take them off because they were so comfortable. I'm a 4 hips and 0 waist and the size small fit well.

links_reviews_title: Very comfy, sporty, and chill, yet still easy to dress up if need be!
links_reviews_text: They were form fitting and accentuating without being too tight or too baggy. Would definitely recommend for photoshoots, and everyday cozy time!
These pants are so soft and great for hanging out/traveling in.

links_reviews_title: okay dress, but more for tall people
links_reviews_text: This dress looks better on the web site than when I wore it. it's better for tall people. I am 5'4, but it feels too long for me. the chest is not securely covered, need a cami under it. the buttons keep falling off, I had to sew the buttons back THREE times.

I felt like I was in a power suit at work! I love how it gives off a crisp clean look. As some others may have said, the top button was a tad tight. You may need to wear a tank top underneath. Absolutely loved it though!

This dress was a little tight through the shoulders and top of arms, otherwise would have bought it. Absolutely beautiful. Heavy fabric, great length and movement. As others have mentioned, was wrinkled when arrived. Allowed to hang in bathroom while showered and most wrinkles fell out. Beautiful and unusual color - hard to tell from the pictures but is a slightly rose taupe. I wore with dusty pink and brown shoes.

links_reviews_title: This dress is gorgeous! Everyone asked me where I got it from and how beautiful it looked.
links_reviews_text: I am a size small but unfortunately they did not have my size, It was a little big but not too noticeable. The V line was lower than I like but over all gorgeous dress.

Like other reviewers I ended up wearing a black cami underneath it because otherwise it would've been two low cut for work. I really liked this overall but let me tell you it is a BEAST to get all the wrinkles out. It came so wrinkled that I almost suspected it of not being dry cleaned beforehand - I knew RTR wouldn't let that happen but that's just how bad it was. Don't rent this unless you have the time to steam it for at least 15 minutes as it is very heavy fabric.

links_reviews_title: Mostly wore it as a coat and loved that
links_reviews_text: Just fine in the waist but very tight in the ribs so it was more comfortable as a jacket, which was more versatile anyway. Lovely color and material.
Snug along rib cage and bust. Low cut. Beautiful, classy, high quality fabric. Nice buttons, great w gold jewelry.

Loved this dress. It looks like a trench coat - in a dress. Elegant and playful, I wore it with and without scarves and with different style (high heels) shoes and it changed the total look. Wear to work, wear to everyday, wear it all day long - it's comfortable and beautiful, and very flattering to an hourglass figure (small waist probably required or size up).

This dress still has the tags on when it arrived. Very professional looking dress. I received compliments literally as soon as I walked in the door, and they kept coming all day. It was fitted through the bodice, so if you are chesty, you probably should size up.

links_reviews_title: Beautiful dress but not for people with boobs!
links_reviews_text: This was a beautiful dress, well-made. However, the top button literally came up to the bottom of my chest. No chest coverage at all. And quite tight at the waist. Order a size up to be safe! Those with large busts should be prepared to wear something underneath.
Too tight in the bust and shoulders, much too low cut for work, needs a shirt under.
Couldn't wear -- usually a 4 but it wasn't even close to being able to button up-- sadly

links_reviews_title: Beautiful dress. I rented it for work but it is low cut so felt a uncomfortable wearing for work
links_reviews_text: Perfect fit. Very tailored and high quality fabric
I was very excited to wear this dress but it didn't fit and one of the dress buttons fell off as soon as I took it off the garment bag.

links_reviews_title: Complements! Had to wear a cami underneath as it is cut too low for church.
links_reviews_text: A bit tight for my bust, but the material and design I loved. Swing when I walked. Makes a statement with the buttons.

links_reviews_title: Was going to wear to work.
links_reviews_text: It's a really well made dress and super classy for work. But the reason why I didnt end up wearing it is because it was really low cut on me and my bra was showing. I would have had to wear a cami underneath it, which I didnt feel like doing. But if you dont mind wearing one, the dress is perfect!
Too big, should have ordered a size down.
nice dress, very tight in the chest (but I have a larger bust). I had to wear a black cami underneath. very good for colder weather, wouldn't really recommend it in the summer.

links_reviews_title: Fashionable, but low cut and tight in the bust for work.
links_reviews_text: The waist, length, color, fabric; all was beautiful for Fall/Winter. The bust area was very snug and low cut if you have anything going on. I ended up putting on a top under it and a busy necklace to district from where the dress would've actually started deep down in my cleavage. It worked and received several compliments. I would rent it again

links_reviews_title: Beautiful 1940s style dress -- perfect for hourglass figures. Lots of compliments! Good tailor!
links_reviews_text: Perfect for hourglass figures. Low cut so best to wear with a tank top if wearing for work and concerned about those types of issues.
Runs VERY small in the chest area and flares out a bit too much. Overall just a weird, unflattering fit. Returned without wearing.
runs small

links_reviews_title: Too small in shoulders and boobs

links_reviews_text: I think it was the big gold buttons that killed it for me. In the picture they looked nice but in person they kept bringing into my mind matronly vibes.

I am a true size 6, 34b and I carry my weight in my hips. I could not button this through the rib cage, the cut is just off. I do not post negative reviews flippantly, this dress is high quality and a beautiful color, the fit is just a miss from this brand.

Beautiful dress, however runs small on my body type. I'm usally size8 and by bust is 36C. I think a LR would have fitted me better. I still made it work and it looked beautiful got many compliments as well. I would rent again just one size up!

links_reviews_title: was way too small in the chest and very low cut.
links_reviews_text: great quality just runs very small.

Dress fit well except the busy area. I'm a DDD I had to go bra less in order for the top button to button. I also wore a tank because it was very low cute. The color was a little odd to me. It was more of a lavender than brown.
this coat made me feel like a million bucks!! Great condition and it felt very luxurious

links_reviews_title: Kind of want to keep it
links_reviews_text: This dusty purple coat is like wearing a warm hug. The pockets are a little far back and there is only one clasp but the coat is so warm and so freaking fluffy and soft that I don't care. I alternate from feeling fabulous to a little absurd in the coat, both of which I kind of enjoy. Might keep it.
Only has a single hook closer, but it is fairly warm if you hold it closed. Loved this coat, I would rent it again.

links_reviews_title: This is very lux faux fur. Very thick, fluffy softness. Great for my winter Napa Winery trip.
links_reviews_text: This is very lux faux fur. Very thick, fluffy softness. Great for my winter Napa Winery trip.

links_reviews_title: The cutest, most warm coat ever!!
links_reviews_text: Fit TTS, a little small at the back/shoulder. I wore it in the middle of winter in Canada & it kept me so so warm, even though it only has one clasp to close the coat in the front. I didn't even need to wear a scarf with the coat bc the collar was so high. My fiancé loved the coat & the color went with every outfit!
This jacket is so soft and very thick! It's perfect for keeping out the winter chill. The color is a great neutral to match to most anything. I was sad when it came time to have to send it back!
This coat was wonderful! It's warm, soft, and looks so classy. I rented it for new years eve and it was the perfect addition to my outfit. I got a ton of compliments on it!

links_reviews_title: Have received quite a lot of compliments and attention:)!
links_reviews_text: It was a perfect fit and it's very warm, plus a welcomed change to my wardrobe which consists of mainly dark coats.

This coat is incredible soft and makes you feel like a 'pimp' in a good and bad way. I loved the coat because it was warm, the collar could come up and it felt expensive. I didn't give it 5 stars because the fit was a little too oversized, it only had the one latch to close it and I felt like Snoop Dog. Would recommend but I would not order again.

links_reviews_title: Gorgeous, soft, warm but not that practical for my needs
links_reviews_text: Pros: the softest, most luxurious fabric. Pretty color. Very warm - did well in high 30s weather walking around NYC during a sunny day. Nice length. Cons: one button. Very bulky. Side pockets are too far back. XS was tight across my shoulders and snug at the hips. May S would work but then the overall fit would be too big. This seems like a coat best used for a special event or where you don't mind it remains open and unbuttoned. I wanted to use for everyday so not that practical for my needs.

This jacket was a lifesaver during a black tie wedding with an outdoor cocktail hour! The ultimate conversation starter with unending compliments & requests to touch the jacket. Warm! Only issue is the pockets are in a bizarre spot for my body, but it was so minor. Would purchase, but have no need to!
Coat is so comfortable and true to size. It is definitely oversized, but I think the small would have been too tight. It buckled in the front perfectly. Absolutely love!
LOVED this coat for an outdoor Colorado wedding. It was definitely a show stopper.

links_reviews_title: Love how cozy it is and the color is beautiful!
links_reviews_text: Pros: The color and the material and the internal fit Cons: The collar is so fluffy it makes a little overwhelming around your face. Otherwise, its
It was supposed to be oversized and I'm usually a small but it was weirdly too small to close and still really oversized-looking. On the good side, it was really soft!

links_reviews_title: so comfy and warm, and such statement piece!
links_reviews_text: very straightforward, large and in charge piece
I rented this for a Mardi Gras Masquerade (military party), and it was so warm and cozy. Fit great, has pockets.

Every time I wear this coat, it is a conversation started ... even on the streets of NYC. The color is beautiful. It is warm, although the single hook and eye closure is disappointing. I would have ordered a size small if it had been available, but the medium has been fine. Definitely the perfect way to be trending and have no regrets when spring arrives.

links_reviews_title: Snug, warm blanket coat. Lots of compliments and I felt glamorous, even in jeans and athletic shoes
links_reviews_text: This coat kept me really warm. Fit was true to size, and I wore it dressy and dressed down. Love RTR coats.
Wore to outdoor wedding ceremony in the winter in the mountains. Simple, dressy and warm!

I rented this just to have something fun to dress up a few occasions I was going to. I probably could have ordered a size down but the small worked. I got a lot of compliments on it. It is warm and just FUN to wear.

links_reviews_title: Worn everyday since September due to the unseasonably cold weather
links_reviews_text: Love love this blanket coat. It's an oversized look-TTS. Fun lavender color very warm with front hook closure. Like wearing a big hug!! Have worn countless times and I just love it!

This coat is rather heavy and warm but there is only a single hook/loop closure in the front which means that if you wear it when it's really cold your whole front side is going to be chilly. That aside, the coat feels fantastic (super soft) and I got several compliments. I ordered a large to accommodate sweaters underneath and it was pretty big.
I got this for a fall trip to Chicago. The coat is beautiful and very comfy but very heavy and too warm for that trip. Will be great for the winter
Adorable faux fur coat! Perfect over my Red Valentino rentals, soooooo adorable!

As I have not left my house in over a month now, my need for fashionable clothing is fading. However, if there was a perfect quarantine outfit, this is it. It is more of a knit than sweatshirt material, but it was still super comfortable. I rented both the top and bottom, but you could certainly separate it and make some cuter outfits and I might do that. I may put my RTR membership on hold, but keep these two pieces for the month. I will wear this more during the time I am stuck inside.
Comfy and quirky pair. Little short on my legs for a 5'9 person but not too bad.
I loved them even if my BF didn't.

links_reviews_title: Fabulous for lounging around family this holiday
links_reviews_text: Super soft, on trend
High waisted, we're a little tight on my waist. But overall fit well.

These are soft, thick, warm and comfy. I usually wear a Small in pants but I wanted these to fit like looser sweatpants. Fit was great with a thick elastic band and unnecessary drawstring (kinda long). They definitely stretched out after a few wears but they were very comfy and attracted a lot of attention! Would love to own and they are dry clean only, btw...

This is really nice 'loungewear'. I expected it to be sweatshirt material, but the pants and top are both knots. I got the medium because I like my loungewear to be loose and comfy. Like I said in the title, I'm considering purchasing this cute set.

links_reviews_title: I'd buy these if summer wasn't right around the corner.
links_reviews_text: Comfy and stylish. Got tons of compliments.

links_reviews_title: Cozy, cute, runs a bit small
links_reviews_text: I rented this for everyday lounging and ended up wearing it tons as a warm, cozy, casual outfit in the hospital. I usually go a size up in Monrow and I was glad I did!
Love love love!
I thought this could be wore outside the house but after trying them on were too much like pajamas. They were cute to lounge around the house.

I have owned plenty of dresses by this designer and consistently wear a 0-2. I rented this in a 2 for me more like a 6-8! It was huge everywhere on me (overall width, arm length, neck) but still pretty short. Unfortunate.

The quality and detail in this shirt is hard to describe but is absolutely everything I have come to expect from Re/done. I am a Small with small bust and big shoulders and it fit perfectly. The pearl snaps, the real embroidery etc. make this a special garment that I am thrilled to be able to wear as part of my unlimited subscription. The birthday is 58, by the way (never give up on fashion happiness ladies!)
Love this top. True to size and comfortable. Would rent again

links_reviews_title: So cute and different but still black and basic
links_reviews_text: Really cute take on a button down. Super soft and comfy. Love the back detail

The embroidery is *legit* and the fabric is so so soft and also warm. People kept running their fingers along the top of my back to touch the embroidery, which, while somewhat invasive, was also kinda nice.

Gorgeous embroidery details on this western-style shirt. The embroidered longhorn skull on the back is exceptional. The contrast of the white embroidery on the black shirt is perfection. It is fitting a bit big on me but that is typical as I am small chested. I will be wearing this as soon as the temps cool. For now simply looking at this exquisite shirt makes this country girl happy.
Cute but not flattering with a long torso
I have a larger chest so I sized up but I wish I got the small. I made it work but I had to tie it. Still great shirt and great quality!

links_reviews_title: So many compliments on this top!
links_reviews_text: Great looking with gorgeous embroidery. Loved wearing this.
I love everything about this shirt, I may never send it back. :o

links_reviews_title: Very soft and flattering! Wore to work with nude pumps for a polished but edgy vibe.
links_reviews_text: The details on the front are subtle, but there is a large longhorn embroidered on the back.
I rented this shirt for a Western-themed wedding reception, and it was just perfect! The small looked a bit better on me than medium, because it's already a looser style.
I loved this piece! So unique and I received so many compliments. Would buy to keep in my closet if it wasn't so pricey... just need to wait on a sale!

links_reviews_title: Loved this shirt and got so many compliments!
links_reviews_text: Nice weight to the shirt, great fabric and super cute.
Boxy style, but cute with the front tucked in. Roll up sleeve with cuff showing.
This shirt was so soft and the embroidery was amazing!
Very soft fabric, great fit.

Loved the fit. Also very comfortable to wear. Stretchy material, usually blazers are tight and tough to drive or sit in for long periods of time, this was the opposite. Easy to wear standing, sitting, driving and working.

I wore this blazer everywhere and got so many compliments. It's so easy to wear and dresses up any outfit without being over the top. Loved it. I'm usually a size 4 but got the 6 for a boyfriend fit, it was perfect.

I loved this jacket! Perfect for a night out - especially as the weather turns chilly. I wore a bralette underneath for the evening - but this also works when paired with more conservative looks like a bodysuit or white shirt. Fabric is heavy and the velvet is a perfect accent. Will definitely keep this in mind for future events.
Very beautiful, but I should have ordered a size 4. :( My fault.
So cute !!!!! You will not be disappointed!

The blazer is very stretchy - not as formal as you'd anticipate from the description - but perfect for work, weekend, date night. It was a lot of fun and I'm considering purchasing it because I loved it so much. Also - be prepared for all the compliments!
Fit was fine, slightly snugger than expected.

links_reviews_title: Love the velvet trim - very comfortable
links_reviews_text: I love that this blazer looked fancier than it's materials. The velvet added a nice touch for this winter event.

Despite the other reviews I found this to be rather large. I was swimming in it and only ended up wearing it once more as an outer jacket for NYE. I loved the look of it and will probably rent again just size down
It was very comfortable and had some stretch but if I could have, I would have gone a size put. Still very beautiful though.

links_reviews_title: Great sleeves and pretty spring color
links_reviews_text: Loved the sleeves and color of the fabric. Perfect spring sweater when it's still chilly/cold. Fabric was not super soft but looked great. Nice fit, a little cropped for tall ladies. High rise pants worked great with the slight crop.
I LOVED this top so much. It is such a flattering fit and an adorable color. I loved how it was slightly cropped and fitting. I'd honestly buy this sweater I loved it so much!

links_reviews_title: Way too short if you're tall
links_reviews_text: I was really excited about this sweater. I loved the look on other RTR members and loved the sleeve style. However, upon trying on the LARGEST size, I couldn't believe how short it was... would look good on anyone 5'6 or shorter. Unfortunately not meant for tall people.

This sweater wasn't a top pick for me originally, but I'm so glad I rented it! I wore it a TON of times because it was casual and comfortable but the slight crop and sleeves were right on trend. Also, the RTR pics made it look like a solid color and it was really more of a purple/blue with speckles if other colors -- I loved it!

Overall just an ok sweater. SUPER cropped and boxy. It works with high wastes jeans but I didn't love it. Almost too short for girls w long torsos - I went up a size to a L yo get extra length and it was just more boxy and extra wide.

This sweater was cozy, comfortable and beautiful - I got so many compliments and loved the extra flare of the sleeves. Because it was cropped I had to be aware of which pants I wore with it to make sure my belly button didn't show but that didn't bother me. Overall I loved this sweater and wish I could have bought it for myself!!
I loved this cropped sweater! The color was really unique and flattering. The sleeves added a fun detail too. I wore it with high-waisted black pants. I definitely recommend!
Love this sweater so much. The bell sleeves make me so happy and takes a basic sweater and gives it a statement! Might buy!!!

This was a beautiful sweater, pretty color and the sleeves that pouf at the bottom were a fun detail. I received a lot of compliments. One thing to note: the sweater was short in the torso. I ended up wearing with high waisted jeans
Fun and unusual color, fun sleeves, comfy. Fit was definitely cropped, so I threw on a sheer tank underneath so that it was work appropriate. Loved everything about this look.

Loved this sweater and would buy if I could! Not too scratchy as far as sweaters go. I went with a large to give the sweater a bit more length to make it work appropriate, and paired it with a black tank tucked into high waisted jeans. A medium would've fit better all over though. The color is great and gave me a lil pop of color to make it through this winter. Would rent again.

I'm 6', so the sweater was extra cropped on me, but with a black tank underneath and high-waisted jeans, it was a hit. The pastel colors are gorgeous, and the sleeves make the sweater. I'm slim, so the sweater was a little big in the waist, but it worked out!

links_reviews_title: so cute and fun and comfy!
links_reviews_text: The sleeves are the real standout on this sweater! They're so cool. The color is a soft lavender with little flecks of purple and other colors. the neck isn't too constricting, and the length is just right on me to pair with high-waisted jeans. I really don't want to give this one back!! I'm normally a medium in tops, but I got the large. It's roomy and comfortable, but I'm definitely not swimming in it by any means. The cuffs keep my hands from getting swallowed up as well. Just phenomenal. I can't say enough good things about it.

The color was amazing. It was a little more cropped than I expected - but I do have a long torso and long limbs in general. The sleeves were another nice detail that set it apart without being too crazy. I'm usually an XS or S but they only had the medium available which worked out quite well for me!
Love the sleeves. Was a little more cropped than I expected.
Overall a fun sweater choice for a more casual office environment, very cute and the periwinkle color was super pretty!
Scratchy material and very short as other reviewers have said. Did not wear.

links_reviews_title: Super cute and easy to wear.
links_reviews_text: Fits more like a crop top, even with my petite height (5'1") I wore it with distressed high waisted jeans and sneakers and it was perfect for weekend activities.
