Looks great with black pants and shoes. Fits true to size with the sleeves slightly long but I'm 5'4. First outfit from this service and I couldn't be happier with the look.
soft basic sweater for everyday

This is cuter than I though it would be and fits better than it looks on the model - definitely true to size. The detail has a bit of shimmer to it but nothing crazy. Comfortable and flattering - get it!
It's definitely a looser fit and fell a little below my belt line. I wore it with leggings on the plane and again with skinny jeans. Comfy and cute and not itchy.

links_reviews_title: A...MAZING! Great quality and fits beautifully. Considering buying.
links_reviews_text: Very cozy and flattering
This sweater just didn't fit me right. It was not flattering. I do have broader shoulders so maybe if you are more petite it would work well for you.

links_reviews_title: Great sweater, would size down next time.
links_reviews_text: Great sweater. I'd wear an XS next time though.
I liked this. Sometimes patterns across my chest make me feel bigger, but I wore this over a chambray shirt with jeans and felt totally comfortable. Compliments on the design.
Pros: Soft, thick. Work with jeans and black booties. Cons: None.

links_reviews_title: Better than I expected base on the reviews!
links_reviews_text: Great color! Yes there is some slight and very normal sweater pilling, but not to the extent that it looks old or worn. I would call myself particular and I wasn't bothered. Also based on the reviews I sized down and the fit was perfect. No problem staying on my shoulders and I wore a regular bra just fine and it didn't show in the back
Love this sweater. So easy and very versatile. Heavier and perfect for winter and soft. Pair with tee or nothing underneath for a more trend look. True to size!

I picked this up from the SF flagship store, knowing it was a size too large. It likely would have stayed on my shoulders had I rented the appropriate size. I wore this sweater multiple times for lounging, a vacation and a Christmas party. I loved the colors and the subtle sexiness of the dropped back, however, the sweater was over worn and needed to be de-pilled.

This sweater is chunky and it fits like an old cardigan worn backwards. Overall, very unflattering and I couldn't tuck it in to help with the shape because it was so thick. Swapped this item out for the month, would not recommend!
This sweater I thought was cute to show a little skin in the cold months. I rented the medium and could of gone down a size as the shoulders kept falling down, but really enjoyed it!
I might have just needed to size down, but I went according to the recommendations and sized up. I was wading to swimming in it. Could have been cute if I had sized down.

links_reviews_title: Too big and open with the back
links_reviews_text: This was too big for me. It was a little awkward with the open back and puffed shoulders so it didn't really fall right on me.
Wore without a bra to really emphasize the buttons down the back - so cute! While it wasn't overly large the buttons are low so be mindly of slippage

links_reviews_title: View ALL photos including back before renting
links_reviews_text: Buttons down the back - view ALL the pictures before renting. It's a "backwards look" but was way too big (I am a petite and small wasn't available and Medium just falls off shoulders so I couldn't wear it and skew was way too long (too thick to cuff). Cute but not for me.

links_reviews_title: SO cute, can wear with buttons in front or back
links_reviews_text: I actually wore this as a true cardigan (buttons in front) and loved it so much. Super soft, color is great (was afraid it would be weird on me but I ended up loving it). Was so sad to send this back! Fit is a bit oversized but not more than you'd expect from a sweater.
Got lots of compliments on this sweater! Great color, nice warm knit, and the back button detail was fun. I got lots of compliments on it all day from coworkers

This looked cute in the pics but was just bizarre. It looks giant and awkward, and the design actually makes it look like you are wearing it backwards. Definitely not a keeper. Couldn't even wear it once. And even though i got an xs it was oversized in all the wrong ways. Too bad. Could have been cute
Great statement sweater that's also super comfy. Fit tts and looked great. I kept it for a while and wore it a bunch of times, any time I could. 10/10 would recommend.

The overall color and knit of this sweater is great. The color is very fall and the knit has chunky V shapes. The fit of this sweater is strange. The buttons worn on the back are strange and way too low to be flattering if worn as styled in the photo. Its OK if you wear the buttons in the front, but very open. The sleeves are oversized and voluminous
It arrived already pilled, but even without that it looked a little haggard. Didn't wear. Would have been fine for errand running but the cropped nature just wasn't comfortable. Returned quickly...
Great fit. I'm usually between a xs or s but the xs fit perfectly. I loved the low back! It is cut perfectly so I could wear it with a normal bra and had no issues.
Very cute and VERY warm. Only downfall for me was that I didn't have a bra that worked with the low cut back so had to go braless for the day!
I loved this top. I wore it out on the weekend and it was perfect for spring temperatures. Flowy sleeves and the cropped cut went perfect with jeans for a causal and cute outfit
Bell sleeves made this extra adorable, large neckline which does mean it moves around a lot so I was constantly pushing it back into place

links_reviews_title: I wore this to work and everyone said it was cute.
links_reviews_text: I gravitated toward this product based off the cool tie dye design. The fit of this shirt is loose, I am wearing a medium, but would definitely still be comfortable in a small. I wouldn't go up to a large as I feel I would be drowning in it. The bell sleeve and wider opening at the bottom and neckline help to make the style your own. You can choose to pull the front up for a bit of a cropped look or bring it off the shoulder. I loved pairing it with my favorite Madewell jeans and braided belt. The fabric is a cotton blend and soft like a sweatshirt. I don't have any negatives about this product as it is cute, comfortable and trendy. I'd rent this again and again and even consider purchasing it.
I think it is a MUST wear with high waisted jeans. Love the look and you either have to wear a strapless bra or not care about bra straps showing. Recommend as it is softer than you'd think too.

links_reviews_title: Great take on a cute crop sweatshirt
links_reviews_text: It's an oversized fit, super cute! Crop without being too short, off the shoulder, fun bell sleeve! Only con, it does stretch out fast. Just adds to the oversized feel. Will definitely rent again!
It was comfy, distinct and perfect for a girls night in!
The neck line was a bit stretched and not as soft as similar tops. The fit made be feel a bit sloppy.

links_reviews_title: This is such a cute take on a classic sweatshirt.
links_reviews_text: Runs a little big in the shoulders, will probably rent a small in the future. However, it's so cute and fun. Perfect for the Fall.
I LOVED THIS SWEATER. Wore it off the shoulder all day every day. Should have bought it
Cute, but a little baggy on a small frame
Deff meant to be oversized but the sleeves are super annoying. Between eatings or having to wash my hands they were hanging everywhere. Wouldn't rent again.
Fits great! Loose around the neck

links_reviews_title: wore a few times while traveling - SO GOOD. Oversized hangs perfect over 1 shoulder.
links_reviews_text: Belle sleeves, not too cropped - and just effortlessly cool. I want to buy it!
Absolutely love this sweater! It's light & perfect to travel in. Def. one of my favorite rentals!

I'm almost always a small or sometimes medium in tops but decided to order small in this based on reviews. This definitely runs big and the head opening is wide, so bra straps would be shown. Could be cute if you layered a white tank under but with the big opening and big sleeves I decided not to wear this.
I love this top, it's really comfortable. It has a very wide neck though so I felt a little annoyed that my bra straps kept showing. It's so cute, though.
Awesome! If I didn't wear a high waisted bottom it was a little short but any larger would have ended up with sleeves that were too long. I seriously considered buying it!
This was a bit of a let down. Had a hard time styling it. Comfy though. Maybe better for casual winter wear.
Perfect casual off the shoulder sweatshirt. It did run a bit large but you couldn't tell because of the off the shoulder baggy style that it is. I wore this multiple times. May even rent it again!

This was cute to wear to an exercise class but too informal to wear anywhere else. It was definitely comfortable. I agree with the other reviewers that you should size down. I wore the XS and was glad I did. Wouldn't rent it again though.
Loved the bell sleeve. Fabric is sweatshirt material, so best worn for casual days. I wore with yoga pants one day and jeans and Van's another and it was great.

links_reviews_title: Wore this for everyday errands, etc.
links_reviews_text: Super comfy and flattering. It's a bit of a crop but not too much.

This is a true sweatshirt/Terry cloth-like material. It's not too warm, and is definitely pretty cropped - I usually like my crop tops to hit below the belly button and this one definitely hit a little above it. The sleeves were fun and perfect length - "bell bottoms for your arms" as a co-worker said! lol. Overall, fun piece to rent for a fun and different top.

links_reviews_title: A sweatshirt with a little flash
links_reviews_text: This was a fun sweatshirt I paired with some two tons dark jeans and had fun with it. I agree with other reviews that the large flowy sleeves were oddly placed

Tie-dye is super hot right now, but this just didn't do it for me. I didn't love the neckline end it wasn't that soft. I certainly could have worn it with jeans and sneakers and it would've looked fine,But since I didn't love it I didn't wear it.

Wore this sweater to a film festival and it was the PERFECT cozy snuggly sweater for being in a cold theater all day. I'll definitely rent again, although I think I want a small next time! Fit is very slouchy.
I thought this would be cute but didn't end up loving it. The neck was weirdly wide so it just looked sloppy. Comfy, but not like super soft or anything. Just wore it around the house.

links_reviews_title: Wanted it to work - need boobs
links_reviews_text: I love a great swingy large dress but there was so much room under the armpits that I'm sure would have been better filled out if I was larger than a small B. The fabric was wonderful!! I wanted it to work so badly.
Perfect warm weather bag!

links_reviews_title: Loved it! Great color and great fit.
links_reviews_text: Simple, elegant, & beautiful fit. The material was stretchy yet thick and had a great quality. I was worried that this was going to be too short for work, but it ended up being just right. I paired it with boots and RTRs Waverly Gray Houndstooth Nola Coat and got tons of compliments.

Rented this as part of my update. Love the color, and it's very comfortable. Definitely fitted, I needed shapewear to feel comfortable in it. Lots of compliments at work, no issues except size up if you're in between! I'm a size 6 right now and the medium was very tight.

links_reviews_title: Flattering but fabric is little thin
links_reviews_text: This Medium fit me perfectly, I'm usually a 4-6. Fabric was soft and stretchy but unlined and a little thin. Because of this I didn't end up wearing. Otherwise this dress was flattering/pretty. Just not for me.

links_reviews_title: Perfect for just about any occasion!
links_reviews_text: I wore this to celebrate my husband and my 1st wedding anniversary at Le Bernardin in NYC. It fit like a DREAM; the fabric gave enough that I was comfortable, but it was still form-fitting and showed my shape. Not to mention the color is gorgeous! I highly recommend!
great layered with a blazer for work!

I rented this for an evening work event but found the dress to be too tight in the waist and hips for a work event. My body type is an hourglass and although the fit was nice it was too distracting for a work event. I'd prefer to wear this out for dinner or a date. Very nice thick material which is very forgiving and the color is beautiful! Order a size up if you prefer a looser fit for work or a more conservative look.

I wasn't expecting to love this as much as I did. It's pretty basic but I loved how it fit my body. I felt feminine while not pushing the limits at work. This will definitely be in my rental rotation in the future.

links_reviews_title: It fit like a glove. This is a power work dress.
links_reviews_text: NA

As others have noted, this dress runs small and the material is thinner than I anticipated. Overall, the quality of this dress did not seem as high as for many of the other brands on Rent the Runway. The size Small dress was too form-fitting to wear to work. Color and cut are very pretty.

I rented this as part of unlimited for work. Unfortunately it was a bit short and tight for the dress code at my job, so I ended up not wearing it, which was a bummer. The dress came to mid thigh on me--I'm 5'11'. If I worked in an office setting, it would have been acceptable with stockings. The zipper was bit stiff, but the material is thick and felt like good quality. It was definitely conservative with short sleeves and a mock turtleneck. The cut was body hugging and flattering.

links_reviews_title: Great dress but I should've gotten a large.
links_reviews_text: Dress was great but ended up a bit small. Still wore it but only once.

links_reviews_title: That was the smallest Large-sized dress I've received in a while.
links_reviews_text: Otherwise a good looking dress.
Nice, sleek fit. Slate & Willow tends to run small so I ordered a M and it fit perfectly. The neck isn't tight which can bother me with mocknecks. Definitely recommend.

links_reviews_title: Wish I could have worn this
links_reviews_text: Wish I could have worn this. Runs small and no replacement sent.
Fit great, looked great, long enough to wear to a work dinner
I got this for Christmas and wore it a number a times. Very classy!
The fit was skin-tight. The fabric was fine, but nothing special. Nice dark green color.
Very cute dress but too short for work in my opinion. I would have worn it for a date night.
Tighter than it looks but great material and fit overall.

links_reviews_title: work holiday party dress - was a little too snug
links_reviews_text: Fit was snug. And a bit short - it also rode up so I was constantly tugging it down. The neck hole was pretty small. Very figure flattering though! I think it may have been better if I sized up.

links_reviews_title: Perfect dress for a work event
links_reviews_text: great length and fit

links_reviews_title: Cute style, but it kept riding up when I wore it work pantyhose for work.
links_reviews_text: Seemed to run a little small. I usually wear a XS in some brands, but this brand a S was more appropriate.

links_reviews_title: This dress is super pretty and tailored
links_reviews_text: It ran a bit small so i dis not wind up using it for work after all, it was a bit too form fitting for my office!
Fit beautifully !! So many compliments , I bought it !!
Wore this shirt to work with pants and heels. It was very comfortable and conservative while still being on trend!

links_reviews_title: That's a no from me dog
links_reviews_text: Sleeves were too puffy to take myself seriously. Style of shirt would be okay for a night out but the print feels more professional. Just felt silly wearing to work so did not wear. Fit of shirt is TTS, sleeves are just puffy.
Good fit. Great design. Loved the puff half sleeve. Very cute ruffle detail.. goes with everything.
Runs bigger than expected. Lots of compliments wearing alone, under a moto jacket. Paired up with dark denim & Chelsea boots. The shoulders are a cute detail fit.

links_reviews_title: Size down if you don't have a big butt!
links_reviews_text: These ran a little big on me but I also don't have much of a butt. They made me look like I do, though!

links_reviews_title: Comfy, good color and weight - a little too much stretch
links_reviews_text: These fit pretty well - I am between a 4 and 6 in pants with stretch and wore the 6. Not sure I would have wanted to go down to a 4 given how fitted the legs are. I have a very narrow waist and while there was no gapping with these, I would have liked a slightly closer fit given the amount of stretch. The rise was good and length was perfect on me at 5'5".

links_reviews_title: I love these - easy to wear no gap in waist and high waist
links_reviews_text: Love!

Definitely size down! I'm 5'8 closer to 140 these days. Most of my jeans are size 27 or 28 (4/6) and I ordered the 2/26 and they fit perfectly!! These aren't the super high wasted ones and the hit about an inch or 2 below my belly button (I have a short torso). They are comfy too! Going to be buying Good American jeans this Fall!

I had been wanting to try Good American jeans since I hear they have a lot of stretch and no waist gap for folks with hips and bottoms. They did not disappoint! The stretch is great and I usually buy a tall in jeans and these regular length ones fit great!
Size down for sure! These are beautiful; I'll definitely be renting other Good American jeans from RTR!

Upon arrival these looked small. Like so tiny I almost didn't try them on, but so glad I did! They are more like jegging material so they stretch, in a good way, in all the right places. They're high waisted and hide any imperfections, no spanx needed. ;) I'm 5'9" and the length was perfect. I dressed these up with a blazer for a work luncheon and will definitely rent again.
A bit short but work well as ankle jeans! Definitely size down, I'm usually a 30 but the 30 was way too loose and the 29 was perfect. Great everyday jeans! (Mid rise)
These jeans were so comfy and stretchy but still true to form and not jegging type thin. I think I need to buy them. I could wear them everyday!

The color of these jeans are fantastic. Wore these all day to a festival - lots of walking, dancing and hanging out and they did not stretch out or get loose. They are perfectly form fitting to curves which is the best to eliminate the large waist gap issues that I always run into. I'm 5'4 and did roll the bottoms up one time. Great rental!

links_reviews_title: Worked well for what I needed.
links_reviews_text: Based on reviews I sized down (would have normally gotten 4R, went with 2R). Glad I did because 2R was perfect. They did stretch out slightly by end of day but not much, and I don't think it was noticeable. I got these to wear with cropped tops and sweaters since they are high rise. They did the trick, but I would have actually gone even higher by an inch or so. Would rent again.

links_reviews_title: Size down! Super comfy and slimming
links_reviews_text: The top of the jeans hit right of my bellybutton. They are super comfortable, easy to move in and the washy very slimming. I normally wear a four or six and I got the 4R and still think that I should have sized down to a two
Way too small, could barely get them on
Incredibly soft denim, super comfortable but these jeans were so big and too stretchy. Im not sure even a 00 would have fit properly.
stretchy, go smaller next time

These fit well to start, but half way through the day I felt like they were bagging out a little bit...i am typically a very strict 4/27 so I think this brand just runs a little bigger because there is so much stretch?
Hugged every curve. Perfect jean. Had to buy.

I wanted to like these jeans, they were so comfortable and a great color. But they're way too big! I'm consistently a 26/2, and sized down to a 0 for these after reading reviews, but still way too big! Wish they came in a smaller size

these were flattering jeans and the high waist hit at the perfect places around the waist: navel high in the front and slightly higher in the back. I should have gotten the 0 but went with the 2 and it was too big. It still worked though.

I normally wear an 8 so being able to wear a 6 in these felt good. The quality of the denim is great. They had a stretch to them that made them very comfortable. I also liked the waistline of these. They gave me the coverage I desire around my tummy area.

links_reviews_title: Very soft, comfortable high rise jeans.
links_reviews_text: This is one size larger than I usually wear and while I think my regular size could have helped to pull in my belly and still fit great, it might have been uncomfortable. This size was nice and tight in the thighs and butt, came up above my belly button and had a little bit of room in the belly area.

links_reviews_title: I wear jeans to work. Its not very magical.
links_reviews_text: These bit like a glooooooooove for us big booty girls! I am 5'10 and the R was a tad short but manageable.

links_reviews_title: Great jeans for the first wear!
links_reviews_text: I loved these jeans the first time I put them on. The fit and color were great but they only lasted a couple of hours before they didn't hold their shape anymore. I ended up wearing them with leggings underneath to football games, but they didn't look nice and fitted for weekend or work.
Wash, length, and fit at butt was good. The high waist kept moving down to my natural waist. Crotch kept slouching low. Not the fit for me.
These jeans fit so well! They have stretch which is great. Comfy too. Love them.
I wanted to try these before buying them and I LOVE them!

These were really comfortable and flattering. I am TTS 16 but found these to be a bit large, especially after wearing them for a short period. They definitely stretch out a lot. Might rent them again but would size down next time.

links_reviews_title: Loved these, great fit, durable denim with stretch.
links_reviews_text: I wore these several times. Impressed with Good American.
Love the midrise, stretch, and color. Works with any outfit, and I felt very stylish. Still debating whether to just buy them.

links_reviews_title: True to fit and very comfortable!
links_reviews_text: Love these jeans so much I ended up buying them. They hold in all the right places yet are so comfortable. Great jeans!
Very comfortable pants , however the waist is a little large and they do not fit snug even at a size small. Very comfy but if you're looking for tighter fit go for the smaller size

I was pleasantly surprised at how much I loved these jeans. They fit like a glove and were super soft. My only slight criticism is that this dark denim wash rubbed off on my hands and backpack after some wear. I'll definitely be renting more Good American from now on.
Didn't love the color but fit was good.
These jeans are like a second skin. They make your legs look amazing. Feel like a million bucks in them.
Runs large

The jeans are super flattering, but run SO big. I wear a 4/27 and I ordered a 2R, but could've probably still sized down. They were too long but extremely comfortable. I think maybe a different style would've been better for me (I'm 5'0").

links_reviews_title: Not as flattering as I'd like.
links_reviews_text: They were very comfortable, but I prefer a jean that give me more security in my tummy area.

I rented these because I wanted to try them out before I committed to buy and let me tell you I am convinced I will be buying them the fit was perfect they are of a stretchy material and a good quality and there is no gap in back
Seriously the best for curvy people. But they run big. I will order a new pair in a smaller size. Perfect for work, date night, brunch, and just about every other occasion.
I really liked this dress, soft blue with leopard print! The fit in the chest was a little tight, but still fit. I wore this for a (virtual) happy hour! It would be too short for work.

links_reviews_title: Love the cute and color of this dress!
links_reviews_text: The cinching at the waist is great and the material is light for warmer weather

This dress is so cute! It's the perfect sporty-girl-edgy dress. I did wear a softer bra because it was too tight with my normal one. The dress doesn't have much stretch, but the zipper helps because I could adjust it to where my bust wasn't so squished (I wore it zipped down; otherwise it is kind of a mock neck). I wore it with tights and boots since it's cold outside. I have short-ish arms so I had to fold the cuff once, but it made my waist look small and the puff shoulders are a cute detail!

links_reviews_title: Confident & stylish for my tv interview
links_reviews_text: Not even offended I had more feedback about my cute outfit than the actual interview. Love that it zips in the front and the print is fun but sophisticated.

links_reviews_title: Fun an flattering- tall girls beware
links_reviews_text: Very flattering if you are hippy with a small waist. Super short though so tall girls grab your tights!
Beautiful material. Great fit. Got lots of compliments.
Great dress! Would love to rent again, tons of complements...loved the a-line fit, super flattering.
This dress transitioned well from day to night and fit my hourglass figure perfectly! Would definitely rent again!

I rented this several months back and got so many compliments. It's extremely flattering. Think it looked better with booties (when I wore it in the summer) than with over the knee boots though. There are a bunch of similar styles (color, leopard print) dresses on RTR but I think this one is the best execution of the style

links_reviews_title: Good overall but I have broad shoulders so it was very tight.
links_reviews_text: Overall great look and material feels good. It's very true to size.
This was super cute, although a little short. Paired with tights and a jacket to dress it up.
Super cute fully zipped or 1/2 zipped. It's cut a lined so if you are bigger than a 34D go up to an 8 otherwise it will come unzipped.
Super cute, feminine, and cut to flatter! Received many compliments on color and print!

links_reviews_title: Loved loved this dress !!! Wanted to buy it
links_reviews_text: Well made flattering just perfect

links_reviews_title: Great fit around waist and length
links_reviews_text: Fit well throughout around waist and dress length. Sleeves were a bit long for me and I needed to roll them once.

This dress was so fun and flattering for the most part but if you have slightly wider hips/are curvier, it can be a little bit snug on the hips and the slip can ride up a little bit which doesn't affect the dress too much but can feel uncomfortable if you're wearing it around walking or at an office.
Perfect mix of conservative and fun. Slightly tight across the chest if you're a 32DD

Pls excuse the Target bathroom photo. This dress runs small, I'm usually a 6 and the 8 was JUST right; tbh a 10 would probably have worked too but definitely not any smaller. The front detail makes it flattering and very striking print, would love to own this!
I like this dress a lot. Very flattering and super comfortable. Fabric is so nice and beatable. Love the print as well. I will def. rent it again.
Great fit and comfortable
Surprisingly cute and flattering. My bf loved it. I usually wear a 4 but they only had a 6 and it fit perfectly (there's no stretch to the fabric). Would rent for a night out but not the office.
The zipper and shoulders on this dress make it unique. Super versatile. It's a keeper!

Beautiful dress, flattering fit and luxurious fabric. However, it is deceivingly short due to the side slits and circle hem. Would be more work appropriate when the weather cools down with black tights and booties. But I rocked it for a day of meetings with flats anyway because I loved it so much. Just had to be extra careful navigating daycare drop off. Would pair well with sexy heels for a party or wedding. Runs a little small. Size up for more room in the rib cage and shoulders. Also, false advertising on the pockets! None to be found.

links_reviews_title: Figure flattering and great material. Loved it.
links_reviews_text: This dress is so adorable on. I paired it with black leggings and black booties - it was a little cold outside and the dress runs a little short. When I tried it on my husband said "Oh, I really like that." It hugs your curves in all the right places and is very figure flattering. Will rent again.
I usually wear a 4 or 6 and the 6 in this dress did not come anywhere near zipping over my chest (34DD).
Fit a little tight in the shoulders
Fits great. Can unzip to be sexier

links_reviews_title: Super cute--looks great with tights and boots
links_reviews_text: I wore this with tights and black suede boots. It was super cute. Love dresses with long sleeves. I didn't love the very visible front zipper but loved everything else about it.

links_reviews_title: Could use a belt. Center fit a bit strange on me.
links_reviews_text: Beautiful color.

links_reviews_title: Love the fit and received many compliments.
links_reviews_text: Runs small if you have larger chest. I wore with leather legging and boots. I would have kept, but had a small tear on the side.

links_reviews_title: Nothing - I wore it to work!
links_reviews_text: This dress is cute, but probably a little much for the typical office. It also was a little short, though I did wear tights underneath. The main problem was that the zipper was difficult to operate - it tended to get stuck most times. Overall, it's a cute dress but I would not rent again. Also, size up if you have hips or a booty - it is a little snug in those areas.

links_reviews_title: Would be great for a younger person.
links_reviews_text: I really wanted to love this dress, but it just wasn't for me. I was hoping it would be longer on me as I'm only 5'3", but it was still mid-thigh length and inappropriate for my work setting. The fabric wasn't as vibrant as I was hoping for either and the zipper catches on the lining when zipping up so be careful!
Good fit and cool dress, but a tad too short when you sit down. Ooops!
Loved this dress but I had to size up!
I rented a 2, my normal size, and wasn't even close to being able to get it to zip. It's a cute dress but size up!
Obsessed with this dress. it is perfect for transitioning from a day at the office to a night on the town.
Definitely size up!
tight on the chest but very loose and long sleeves. material also feels cheap

Could zip it up over my ribs! So cute on the hanger and fit in terms of length and sleeves. So bummed but loved the pattern! Feel like two sizes up would fit me in the chest but would be way too big elsewhere.

links_reviews_title: Soft lightweight silk dress has a spark of attitude with the print, puffy shoulders, zipper & skirt
links_reviews_text: This dress is great for work or a party. The bodice is form fitting, larger busted ladies have to size up to squeeze into the chest. The zipper makes it happen. The sleeves are long, the skirt is swingy, shoulders puff up a bit, and sleeves are a bit exaggerated. This printed silk dress makes a statement while being very comfortable. Taller ladies may find it short.
While this ran large, it was perfect for my 20 week bump. Hangs in a flattering manner and loved the colors.
This fits super well! I didn't realize the material is a shiny gold, but still very cute.

Fit runs a little large (xs still had room for me plus it's stretchy). Was not expecting the gold shimmer but loved it all the more! It's practically a full length skirt for me since I'm 5'1 but didn't look bad at all. Definitely will wear and rent again!

At 45 you would think I had learned - after all this time- that knits aren't entirely my friend. And yet, I continue to hope and pray for a knit outfit that looks amazing on my frame! I need to let this dream die. I know I do. This photo is flattering. If you check the side view you see a different story- my butt - which is actually fairly high and perky for my age and stature - looks like a flat pancake; there is no definition between the small of my back and the large of my booty, I don't even know how that happens. The back of the top clings to my ...let's call them "lats" instead of back fat. It is all rather unfortunate. I made the best of it for work, because the only thing I hate more than a flat ass is waste. I dug up this vintage belt and did a bit of magic to pull off the waistline and put some super boring brown jimmy chop pumps to work. All in all, with a dash of red lipstick, I was satisfied. With the front view.
Lovely fit

I originally rented this to wear for a business meeting, but didn't realize how glittery the fabric was. So, I chose something else for the meeting and wore the skirt to take myself out to dinner in Paris while on a business trip. The fabric makes it feel special, and the forgiving waist makes it perfect for eating lots of steak frites. Would definitely rent again.
Loved this skirt's look, how it's made, and it's comfort. 5 stars all around

links_reviews_title: Nice skirt with a little sparkle
links_reviews_text: Nice comfy skirt, paired with a black top. Wore to work, got lots of compliments.

links_reviews_title: Really cute skirt for work to drinks!
links_reviews_text: The skirt is stretchy, so I would recommend sizing down so that it snatches your waist.
The material is stretchy so would be forgiving if between sizes. Material is heavy and scratchy but looks great, good for fall/winter. The gold sparkly material makes it a bit more formal.

Awesome. Managed to wear the metallic at work. One day with drapey black tee tucked in. Another with white top and ballet flats. Mad comfortable. Looked great! Plenty of flexibility at waist and elastic if you're pregnant or need a little more room here and there.

Loved the heavy knit and subtle glitter of the fabric. It runs much larger than ALC usually does, normally my rectangle waist barely fits this brand. The XS skirt was actually loose on my waist and the skirt sat lower than I would have wanted (basically rested on the largest part of my abdomen, which...ugh). Recommend sizing down for anyone with smaller waists.
Runs large
This was very pretty and fit well but it was a little more festive than I felt I could pull off for work so I didn't end up wearing it.
Flattering! I'm preggers and felt great in it, but would have loved the fit regardless.
Pair with a plain black turtleneck and boots for day, then add a gold-toned scarf and change out the shoes for evening. Very comfortable and versatile!
I LOVE this skirt. SUPER comfortable. I paired it with a Rolling Stones t-shirt, boots and a jean jacket.
Wore this for an interview at work with a blazer and a turtle neck. I definitely did not need to size up. The medium would have been perfect. This fits true to size
Fits well, well made, super comfortable but also adds a bit of fun sparkle for work.
High quality heavy fabric with shimmer. Great winter skirt that works well and provides warmth over tights. Wore for work and vacation
Rented thinking this was appropriate for work but did not realize it is sparkly glittery textile - returned without wearing
Fit is true to size. I’m 5’11 and it hits below the knee at a midi length. Super comfortable and chic.
Beautiful, but heavy skirt. Wish I had more reason to wear it. Would be perfect for the holidays.

links_reviews_title: Would have been cute but was too big to wear
links_reviews_text: Wished it was smaller

links_reviews_title: Comfortable, elegant and true to size
links_reviews_text: Thick beautiful material that is not scratchy. Elastic waistband made it perfect holiday attire for my postpartum body and was flattering to wear the skirt high at my natural waist.
Great, thick fabric. Easy skirt to give you a classy, polished look.

The thick fabric and midi length of this skirt makes it great for fall/winter. I also really like the subtle metallic sheen - festive enough to wear to a holiday party but also not just understated enough to be appropriate for everyday wear as well. The only issue I had is that the waist is quite loose and because of this, the skirt hung lower on my body than I would have liked. I generally have the opposite problem with A.L.C. clothes.
I received lots of compliments on this skirt. My only complaint would be that I should've picked XS instead of small. However, I did wear this on Thanksgiving so it was a little more forgiving!

Beautiful thick material with golden thread throughout, making it easy to dress up or down. I ended up not wearing it as I couldn't find anything in my closet that i loved it with. Will look to rent it again with a matching piece next time!

Amazing. Debating keeping it ! Stretchy waste allows you to wear at different heights - i'm short so was worried about length but wore high waisted and was still midi length. Tiny bit scratchy from metallic strands but nothing bothersome
Medium size, A little bit stiff for my taste, but very good looking

Looks so chic and clean. Stiff bag with 3 dividers and the center can be zipped up. The longer strap is short and doesn't quite work as a crossbody but is great for a shoulder bag. Keeping this one for awhile!
Gorgeous bag. One large pocket separated with a zipped pouch in middle. Perfect for those who like to carry around everything with them. Received so many compliments on it!
Came as new!
I wore this to a work event and I was pleased with how comfortable the jacket was. Not super warm though, so plan to layer!

links_reviews_title: SO WARM & great for Midwest winter
links_reviews_text: I wish I had been able to rent this one size down. My only complaint was it was a tad too big and there aren't very many buttons. But it was super warm without being bulky and could be dressed up or down.
Super cute print and colors! This coat was perfect for layering, as it still had plenty of room for clothing underneath without feeling too bulky.
Super warm coat that's really trendy and cool. Wish I could have kept it! Runs large for sure
This coat is so comfortable and very warm. I styled it with so many outfits I was surprised how many different things it went with!

Oversized fit but I loved that bc you can still fit a chunky sweater underneath and be comfy. Even though it has a design, the coat went well with all my clothes. Really recommend, I've rented it twice already

links_reviews_title: Favorite jacket ever!!! I kept this piece for a couple of weeks because it is so versatile
links_reviews_text: Slightly oversized
Cute, kind of preppy looking oversized coat.

Love this Derek lam coat! It's super comfy and runs pretty large - I could've probably sized down but I prefer the oversized look. It's definitely a true navy coat and I love the look with the yellow/gray stripes. It also has big pockets (useful)! Not itchy at all. I'm going to have a hard time sending this back!!
honestly i should have bought it, it was so gorgeous! definitely on the lighter side.
I love a cocoon shaped jacket but this one was just bleh.

links_reviews_title: Gorgeous coat, didn't work with my wardrobe.
links_reviews_text: Really beautiful coat but the navy, citron, and lilac color way went with nothing I own.

Great jacket great cut, but something about the way the grey and the yellow blend when you look at it in person gives the jacket more of a navy look. It's not bad it's just something to be aware of if you're looking for black
runs big. too much coat for me.

links_reviews_title: Loved this jacket but it does run large!!
links_reviews_text: This jacket is gorgeous and can be dressed up or down really easily! It's perfect for warmer days during the winter, spring, and fall. It definitely runs a little big, even for an oversized fit. If I were to order this again, I would go a size down.
Usually jackets like this don't fit my body type, but this one did! Received compliments and kept me warm.
The coat is super warm. I love the color combo and oversized fit. I splurged and bought it, but sized down to a 0.
Great winter coat for So Cal.

links_reviews_title: This coat was cute and pretty warm for not-freezing winter days!
links_reviews_text: I wore this as an everyday coat and it was a nice change of pace/cute pattern. Its definitely a larger-looking coat, but that's the look so if you're looking for something more form-fitting this is probably not the coat for you.

I'm petite and while the coat definitely ran longer on me than it did on the model (closer to knee length) a size 2 still fit well overall. The navy, yellow, and white plaid pattern is surprisingly versatile and pairs with all kinds of colors and even other patterns (hey, why not?). I ended up keeping this coat for a couple of months and wore it in various weather, from chilly New England fall into early winter. It's not warm enough for very cold, snowy days, though, especially since it doesn't button all the way to the top. Would absolutely rent again next season.
Love this coat. It's warm enough for fall weather. It's quite oversized but still looked really cool.

I live in a place with fairly cold, long winters, and this year it seems to have started early. Having this fun warm coat helped break up to coat monotony. The fabric is very warm but not bulky; I was warm and cozy even on nights that got down to the low 20's. The pattern is fun and funky without being overwhelming, and this piece went well with the rest of my wardrobe, dressed up or down. The fit is a bit big in the shoulders and arms, but I took it as being part of the style.

links_reviews_title: It was an interesting take on an otherwise conservative looking jacket.
links_reviews_text: Slightly over-sized on purpose but it can make you look a little boxy.
Loved this jacket. It's definitely oversized which gives it a relaxed look

this jacket is super cute. I don't normally wear a 12 so it may run a bit small, but that could just be because I'm taller with broader shoulders. Its warm, great length and super cute. Get compliments all the time!

Favorite coat rental from RTR to date! It is the perfect camel color (which is strangely hard to find), great length, and feels like it's tailored just for me. It's thick so I don't think I'd be able to wear a sweater underneath but that's fine since California decided spring would start in February this year. Wish I would've rented it when it was colder around here!

I wanted a long coat and something on-trend - this was perfect. I loved it so much, I wore it every day for about 2 weeks. It's honey/caramel colored, not camel. I needed something warm for 35° weather and despite the single button and low V neck on this, it was outstanding. It's a really heavy material (so I wouldn't wear it over 50°) and super high quality. It does have a bit of shoulder padding and a boxy cut, so if you have broad shoulders just be aware. I fit a sweater under the small.
Super fab coat - i threw it over jeans and a turtle neck a few times!
This coat was amazing!!! I wore it almost everyday - great color and fit. Warm too.
warm, nice fitting
Ran a bit big on me, but i'm rather petite so I assume I probably needed an xxs. Overall pleased with the coat

links_reviews_title: Quite small in the shoulders , but really posh
links_reviews_text: The shoulders and arms are really small. I wish I had ordered the large. I often wear a small in tops but I do have athletic shoulders, so I ordered the medium. The large would have been better. Other than that, the fabric was AMAZING and I got lots of compliments. It was pretty warm, but not warm enough for 30-degree days. For those days I had to switch to down.
Pros: -good lining -fit true to size Cons: -comically poor quality on the wool; like super low-rate felt that pills -odd, unflattering button placement and fit

links_reviews_title: Beautiful cut and color, fits true to size.
links_reviews_text: I was expecting this to run large as many of the RTR coats with this cut do. This one fit true to size. Normally I'm a 2-4, rented an XS and it was too small in the arms. I should've stuck with the Small, which would be true to size. Beautiful coat and color, would rent in my size next time.

links_reviews_title: Loved these so much, I bought them
links_reviews_text: The compression "shapewear" corset waist is so flattering and yet these jeans are comfortable enough to nap in (I did). These are the first jeans I've tried that are stretchy with the fabric still being thick and that hold shape. The crop is very flattering and I loved these too much to send them back.

links_reviews_title: Love the style, didn't fit my petite body
links_reviews_text: These pants are so cute, I’m a bit bummed that I couldn’t wear them. A size 0 can be a 23” waist - a 25” waist. The “Style and Fit” details on the product page didn’t mention what the waist size was and a few of the reviews mentioned they were tight so I ordered them! Still gave them 4 stars because I love the style and was able to get a photo of them !

These jeans are amazingly soft and comfortable, and the raw hem at the bottom adds a really fun touch. For me, these pants fit well on the legs but the waist was entirely too big so I would personally size down if I were to rent again. I wore these to work and out at night so good as a transitional piece!
Great fit! Lots of stretch! High waisted! Cool faded black!

Super comfy fabric and very flattering just like all Good American. Perfect high waist. As you wear them they loosen up a ton so next time I'm sizing down to a 0 usually a 2. The 26 is more like a usual 27.

links_reviews_title: These jeans are so comfortable. They fit great!
links_reviews_text: I wore these to work with another RTR blouse. Got lots of compliments!

Rent these jeans!! Pulled them out of the bag and laughed out loud because they looked TINY. But like some kind of magic, they fit PERFECTLY. My husband even commented on how good they fit. Thick, nice fabric but stretchy in the right places. High waisted and holds everything in place. So comfortable! For reference, I'm 5ft 2 and a true size 8. If in between sizes size down because they do stretch a little throughout the day. I would buy them if they were less expensive but would def rent again.

PROs- •thick material •clearly good quality jeans •length was good even for a shorty like me! CONs- •high waisted left mid section bulky •if I sized down, legs would be too tight but waist would fit •still wore them! and would wear again.
These are probably the highest waisted jeans I've worn, but I loved them. Great for a crop top and very comfortable. Got a couple of good wears out of them.

Nice fabric, a little stretch, but just enough to provide some "give." I drove 3 hours in these jeans then walked to dinner in the humid river walk area in Little Rock and I could still wear these again without having to do a thing to them.
I keep thinking about how I wish I bought these jeans! Great material for winter, so comfortable and super flattering!

links_reviews_title: Awesome fit. I love that it was truly high-waist and shaping.
links_reviews_text: Fabric is comfy and sturdy at the same time, it doesn't stretch out with wear!
Perfect amount of stretch, heavy quality denim, so comfortable.

links_reviews_title: Loved the high rise. I'm typically a short inseam, so the cropped leg was perfect!
links_reviews_text: Length was great (I'm usually a short inseam). High-rise hit at a good point. The pockets were very flattering on my curvy butt.
I love GA so I knew I'd love these! I was surprised that this jeans weren't stretchy like the GA jeans I've worn. Nonetheless, it was still great.

I should've gotten my regular size. They are stretchy, so my regular size would've been perfect. They were pretty flattering besides the waist area not fitting me well at all. I want to try them again in a size down!
Stretchy but not too tight. They are high, but not to your bra - just like right above belly button
Too big and well worn-in but I really want to try a size down! I loved these!
Are you sure these are really good American?!Because I've worn their brand before and I love them. These jeans are heavy, no stretch, the 14 fit like a 10. Major thumbs down.
I had rented the 14R and it was too tight, and sadly the 16R was too loose and long for me. The material was great though and bummed it didn't fit me better.

links_reviews_title: Wore these running errands with the kids.
links_reviews_text: I own multiple pairs of GA denim, but this was my first time trying the curve. They are my new favorite style. Very flattering, and definitely hug your curves. Easy to dress up or down.

links_reviews_title: I received many compliments on these jeans- they are very stylish
links_reviews_text: The waist was slightly large- but the length of the pant was perfect for me and I am 5'5.
Cute but no stretch - couldnt get over my knees

links_reviews_title: Can't take these off! They are SO flattering and the material is thick enough!
links_reviews_text: Perfect fit- everywhere!

I have such a hard time finding jeans, so I wasn't very optimistic about these pants. I was SO happily surprised. They fit great, are so comfortable, and really great quality. I love them so much I might buy them
These plants were great! The only con is that they do stretch out realllly fast - order a size down!

links_reviews_title: These jeans are AMAZING!!! The feel and look are top notch.
links_reviews_text: It is exciting to know I need to probably go done a size due to the quality of these jeans. I loved the high waist as I always have difficulty with the back of jeans and gap. No issues here.
Cute jeans. Love the frayed hem at the bottom. They are suuuuuuper high waisted tho so can be a bit uncomfortable when sitting.
These are super high rise but well-made and comfy!
Seems like great jeans, but I would size up.

links_reviews_title: Great jeans for wearing with crop tops
links_reviews_text: Really high waist! makes your hips look wider because of the same reason but great in every other way

links_reviews_title: Love Good American, Didn't Love These
links_reviews_text: Lower waisted than I prefer. I sized up because GA black jeans tend to run smaller and they were still too tight- normally wear an 18.

links_reviews_title: Feel pretty, sexy and slim in these jeans!
links_reviews_text: Very highwasted, a tad small and snug in the waistline, everywhere else has some stretch to it.
Can't get over how well these fit! Definitely going to purchase these at some point.

links_reviews_title: Wore to farmer's market. Good for any occasion- could dress up or down.
links_reviews_text: fit well and super comfortable. waist particularly high.

links_reviews_title: Adorable. Love Khloe but they're big.
links_reviews_text: I wore these for everyday, to make my casual style feel more glamorous. They're super cute but didn't fit right in the thigh/stomachs area. Too big. Would definitely rent again at a smaller size.

I am curvy but not overly curvy and 5 feet tall. They were a tiny tiny bit long but not much. They came up to my belly which I loved because I could wear shorter tops with it. My rear looked amazing and I got so many compliments about how skinny I looked. IF you are looking to look thin rent these jeans. I am almost positive I will be buying them.
Fit is great and they accentuate the curves.
Dress up or dress down
The arm wholes show too much but I would rent again for work, just not an event I'd have to worry about my bra showing in a photo.
This top is cute and comfortable for work, but you'll need to wear a camisole with it because the arms gape a bit.
Nice material made the top dressy enough for daytime and easily transitioned to after work. Really comfortable, highly recommend for a simple, high-end basic piece!

I loved the design of this shirt. It took me a little while to figure out how to correctly put on the shirt, because the style was new to me. I loved the fit of this shirt and it was perfect for work! I had to wear a black tank top underneath because it's too barring in a formal setting. But I'm sure for an evening event, it would be perfect to wear without a tank underneath.

links_reviews_title: Wanted to like it but gap in the back
links_reviews_text: Wanted to like this but the gap in the back made it not appropriate for work
I don't like the material it feels like a nurses scrub. Tying it to the side makes it look better than in the front

links_reviews_title: Nope, Nope, Don't need to show off back far
links_reviews_text: Ok, so it's a wrap shirt, and we ladies are used to worrying about gapping in the front, but on this shirt you have to worry about it IN THE BACK! If the shirt isn't properly tied or if it shift, it will show off your BACK FAT. WTH! Yea, obviously didn't wear this one cause there was no need to stress about what would show if I sat down at the office or walked across the office to talk to someone. That could have been so awkward.
I should have ordered this to wear in the summer. its rather 'airy' and the sides are kind of open for everyone to see in. Would have been fun for an outdoor event or in the summertime.

I really liked this, but it felt too complicated so I only wore it once. You also need a cami underneath, as the arm holes are large. It was also pretty long, which I thought wouldn't bother me but it did.

links_reviews_title: Perfect for work or weekend, date night, anything.
links_reviews_text: Fit well, perfect length and love the tie detail.

links_reviews_title: Out of the ordinary in a good way
links_reviews_text: This blouse works like a wrap around. It is light weight and with the wrap can shift around a bit but kit was fun to wear something different and the lovely V neck showed off my favorite choker necklace nicely.
Can look a bit like a maternity shirt and took a minute to figure out how to put it on.

links_reviews_title: Loved it so much I bought it
links_reviews_text: I was looking for a black top I could dress up or dress down. I liked that this had a tie and was a bit more interesting. Did take a second to figure how it goes on (it remind me of a smock). Upon putting it on I immediately smiled. Wore on a date with my boyfriend who complimented my shirt, venturing around new towns, and even out for drinks with colleagues after a conference. I can adjust just how much peek-a-boo action there is for the lower back depending on the occasion

links_reviews_title: Cute top with a fun cut!
links_reviews_text: This top was fun! Hard to tell from the pics but it goes over you head and wraps from the back- I liked it a lot- borders on a maternity style which is why i didn't give it 5 stars

It is a bit of a hat trick to put on but so very flattering. I like a shirt that has more coverage below the waist so I ordered one size up and wore a camisole underneath. I wore it to my daughters sporting event and I looked appropriate without being too over the top since I wore it with a pair of jeans.

It's a comfortable, everyday ware, shirt. It actually deconstructs to a poncho and then ties around the middle. A bit shocking and slightly confusing at first to put on. Wares well and easy to dress up or dress down.
You'll need a camisole underneath because of the wide-open, low-cut sleeves.

links_reviews_title: Like it but kind of long
links_reviews_text: Long

links_reviews_title: Nearly perfect top, just size down
links_reviews_text: Amazingly flattering, comfortable and classy, just runs WAY large. Once I figure out what size works best (possibly even two sizes down) I might just have to buy it. The main reason I RTR is to sustain my ridiculous habit of becoming bored with even the most beautiful clothes by the second time I've worn it, but this would make the cut of earning a coveted spot in my permanent closet. Well done Diane.
Thinner fabric than expected. Really liked but not for the outfit I anticipated.

links_reviews_title: It a classic blouse; nothing special
links_reviews_text: I liked it but nothing really special about it. I always wanted to wear a Diane Von Furstenburg anything so thought I'd try it. No complaints as to the quality. Its a classic blouse and could be worn a lot of ways.
My only concern was that this is a wrap top and it was very low cut on the sides. I needed to wear a tank underneath to conceal my bra at work.

links_reviews_title: Felt good about how I looked.
links_reviews_text: Great top - very elegant yet casual. I wore a black cami underneath as it can be a little revealing.
Na

links_reviews_title: I love this shirt and will be watching for the price to go down so I can nab it.
links_reviews_text: even with a large bust the shirt fit great. I wore a body suit under as the material can slip and show the back. sexy on some, not me. :)
This was very attractive and comfortable.
na

links_reviews_title: NOT work appropriate, but super cute
links_reviews_text: So from the photos this looked very chic, modern, and totally modest enough to wear to work. It is both chic and modern, but it is NOT something I could ever wear to work. Firstly, I felt like I needed an instruction manual to put it on: there's a little loop that adds some amount of structure, then kind of a tent flap that goes over the head so that the rest can be wrapped around. The end result is something I can't wait to wear out this weekend, but had to immediately take off because it showed way too much of my sides and bra to ever be something I could wear to the office. I definitely picked this out of a "work edit" series, so I was frustrated, but I do have other plans for this little number.
Great shirt for work. Very comfortable and chic top.
I wanted to love the shirt, but there was an awkward gapping in the back and under the arms - had to wear a camisole underneath. In addition, the shirt kept coming untied in the front.

This fits a lot like a smock - a big square of fabric with a neck hole in it. The sash makes the waist and is what covers up your sides. There is also a band of fabric lower down that encircles your waist on the inside of the smock. It looked really good! It is on the longer and looser side, but very flattering. I wore with jeans, but you could make this work with patterned pants or skirt. It wrinkles like the devil.

links_reviews_title: there is not a true back to the shirt. it's more of a bib
links_reviews_text: awkward style

links_reviews_title: I wanted to wear this for date night.
links_reviews_text: The material is beautiful and the drape is great. It looked really nice from the front, but the armholes were so large that most of my bra was visible from the side. The sash wraps from back to front, with an opening that reveals the lower back. I think this would look cute with low-rider pants, but since I prefer a higher waist, the opening showed a sliver of skin and the waistband of my pants -- it just looked weird. I could have work a tank underneath, but I really wanted the simpler silhouette. I think it was just a bad choice for my particular size and shape and would probably be adorable on someone else.

links_reviews_title: Adds a little extra to basic black blouse
links_reviews_text: Wore it day to night for a work conference and dinner. Wrinkled slightly but was ok since most of the day and evening was sitting
Needed an undershirt for the armholes. Otherwise, simple and elegant. Can go formal or casual
This top is like a bib that ties around the waist. The fabric was very wrinkled and not what I was expecting. Not work friendly and likely won't wear at all.

links_reviews_title: Fun twist on a basic black top
links_reviews_text: Cute top - runs a little small but very cute!

This fit great. Was a little difficult to put on correctly. The armholes are really wide, so need to wear a cami. Didn't wear as much as I thought I would, even though a very simple basic. It needs to go with pants without pockets, with smooth hips or it doesn't lay right.

I really loved the material and color but the fact you had to tie this yourself made me look a little pregnancy with a tail on my belly :/ i tried to wrap to side but then my whole underarm was showing :( did not end up wearing but size was perfect.

Getting so bored of wearing sweatshirts every day and this let me keep the coziness of a sweatshirt but it looks so much nicer! The wrist detail is nice and it's tts so fits more like a top than an oversized sweater. But still very comfortable!
Loved this sweatshirt. I'm between an XS and S and the XS fit well with high waisted jeans. It's slightly cropped but I liked that. The sleeves are a cute detail and made it appropriate for work.

links_reviews_title: Super cute shirt. It's not really a sweatshirt but heavy cotton material. Great with jeans
links_reviews_text: Runs large.
This can be worn as causal work outfit or for a hang out weekend too
The sleeves made this more work appropriate than a regular striped knit would be.
The white sleeve ends add the perfect amount of fun

links_reviews_title: It was too big for me, but cute
links_reviews_text: It runs big, order a size down
Brand new with tags, the fabric is lovely & super versatile. I wore to work & on weekend

I loved the overall fit and feel of this culottes! The high waist and draw string was perfect for my body. I got so many compliments when I paired them with a light denim shirt and white tank. I tied the denim at my waist and popped up the color! Great for every day or could dress it up. The fabric was forgiving and didn't stay wrinkled.

The pants fit well. They wrinkled around the crotch really easily and when I first put them on my mom asked if they were pjs. Overall they're really cute and I ended up dressing them up with heels to give more of a formal feel at work.
I didn't realize these pants have a slit in the leg, which helps them look less like PJs.

I would definitely buy these if they were under $150. They're so fun and different from your average black culotte with a side slit that gives them some edge and lace detail. Paired with a Prabal top also from RTR - lots of compliments on this outfit. But the pants definitely crinkled in the crotch from sitting :( might be better for a standing event or night out. Totally disagree with all the "pajama pant" comments - these are CUTE!
Loved these pants! Navy blue, great material, great fit... very trendy and lots of compliments. Would definitely considering buying these!
Love these!! Fit true to size and could be dressed up or down. They were really flattering and I loved the print. Highly recommend!
Really comfy and cute. Would have hit my ankle better if I was a little taller. Had to wear heels for this style to look balanced. XS was tad tight in the waist, small may have been better.

These are like elegant pajamas, but the cut is flattering and I love the pockets and slight flare. Also, cropped items are often too long for me at 5'5" but this one works. Considering keeping these just because they are so comfy and versatile.
I'm obsessed and wish they weren't so expensive because I'd love to buy them. I'm 5'1 and they're nearly full length for me - which I like, but something to watch. Love the texture and style.

links_reviews_title: Cute pants but I'm not sure what you'd wear them to.
links_reviews_text: More casual than they look so I couldn't wear them to work. If you work in a casual setting they would be good for that. Otherwise, I chelsea really find an opportunity.

links_reviews_title: One of my favorite rentals ever!
links_reviews_text: Rented this for Christmas mass but also wore it to work and some other events. Sooo cute and comfy!
Lovely fabric, embroidery, with a cool side slit on both sides. Only complaint is wrinkles easily

links_reviews_title: Some great details, some strange details
links_reviews_text: Pros: comfortable elastic waistband, large pockets, beautiful details, thick silky material Cons: there are large slits on the bottom outside of each leg (6-9"?) which creates a "flapping wing" effect when walking. It wasn't for me. Takeaway: comfortable and "different" work pants...

links_reviews_title: No event just for everyday wear.
links_reviews_text: These pants are cute, they fit well and look good. I could wear them to work, everyday and dress them up for night. They are a winner.
I wore these multiple times - on a travel day, to the office, put at night. The side skits made them more fun and less pajama-like, and the jacquard pattern was lovely.
These were very comfy without looking frumpy. I wore them with black heals and an oversized denim shirt to work. I got a lot of compliments! The pockets are a nice bonus.

These pants are the best! I had to travel for work and go straight to meetings from our flight so these were the perfect travel option - dressy enough for work, yet super comfortable. Basically fancy pajama pants lol will definitely rent again
Liked these pants although they were a bit big on me since the large was unavailable and went with the XL. These pants are cute dressed up or more casual, and the print is beautiful. Comfy!!
Comfy and flattering cute but the fabric makes them look like pajamas.
Love these! Wore them to work and dinner! You can dress them up with flats or add a heel. Lots of compliments!
I LOVED these pants! They were so chic, and looked cool dressed up and down. They were so comfortable I wore them on a flight. I can't wait to rent again.

These were a out of the range of something I'd normally wear and I ended up loving them. Made me feel like a modern day samurai as they were a tad longer on me than the model in the photo. Wore it with a blank tank and jean jacket as well as a boxy cardigan. Got tons of compliments. Definitely putting this one in my rotation.

links_reviews_title: These pants went with so many things!
links_reviews_text: #glamorous
Nice pants. Very unstructured. Fit comfortably. Totally good for business casual work environment. Would not wear them to a client meeting, however.

These were so so adorable and comfortable! I loved them! I ordered them for work. I received lots and lots of complements on them. I am a size 12/14 in pants and the XL was a perfect fit. They were so nice for summer. I would totally order them again.
love these pants.
easy to dress up or down
The fabric would be cool except that it is not structured enough to avoid the pajama-look. The slots up the sides don't help. I didn't wear these.
Fit well, paired with some colorful flats and a plain white tee. Got many compliments!

links_reviews_title: Chic pants for work or a party
links_reviews_text: Loved these pants- I wore them to work and then later in the week to a post-wedding brunch. The slots in the side are a little funky, but just add to the overall 1970s vibe. They look great with a fight black T-shirt or a flowy tank.
Even more beautiful in person - love the navy and the subtle sheen. Also, love the side slits!
Comfort and professionalism. I had so many compliments on these pants AND got to be comfortable wearing these on a long day. Will definitely rent again.
I felt like an elegant boss in these pants. I love, love, love them. They're like work-sexy PJs.
These pants are why I love RTR - I got to test drive a style I wasn't sure I could wear at my average height. And I loved them! Beautiful fabric, interesting details.
If you have a butt don't get these.

links_reviews_title: Pants fit snug at low hip
links_reviews_text: I rented these pants to wear to an event and they fit uncomfortably snug at my low, low hip. Fit fine in every other spot but pulled tight in that location and had some puckering issues. The fabric is dark enough that it could have worked but I decided against wearing them. Besides the fit issue, the fabric and cut on these is a nice lightweight culotte.
perfect fit

links_reviews_title: Great pants, so cute and unique
links_reviews_text: I wish they were a bit higher waisted - I felt like the rode a bit low on my hips. The slits on the side let in a lot of cold air, so I don't recomend for a cold day. Still really fun pants that I would rent again.
I'm usually a small but should have gotten the xs.

Cute pants and very comfortable, but the fabric and print was a little to dressy for the office. I wore them anyway. The black is a bit shiny and the pattern quite nice but these would have great for dinner out or a party.
SALONI does it again!! Another amazing dress with a fabulous print. Highly recommend! I wore this to a fancy dinner out on vacation.
This dress was so so elegant and could be dressed up or down. Got so many complements!

This was one of my favorite dresses that I've rented from RTR! It was very comfortable and the fabric is lovely. The length was a little long on me at 5'4" but that wasn't a big problem at all. I received many compliments and highly recommend this dress for any occasion!

links_reviews_title: Elegant, sophisticated and love the colors!
links_reviews_text: Another winner from Saloni - made me feel confident and beautiful. Several compliments. Colors are vibrant and dress is elegant. Fit us true to size. Will rent this again!

The lovely colors and print on this dress really make it - it's brighter in person. It was perfect for a pre-wedding welcome dinner (cocktail dress code). I'm 5'2" and it was maxi length on me. I took off 1 star because the shoulders are a little puffed and they made me look super broad but my friends said it wasn't that noticeable.
Obsessed with this dress! The pattern is amazing and would work in any season. Love that the waist cinches in. I wore the 4 bc the 2 wasn't available, but I think either would have worked.
Such a beautiful dress!!! Fits really well, so girly and well made. Fabric doesn't breathe well so a little hot for a 90 degree day, but it flows and looks so nice it's worth it.
I dress fits well but the yoke at the waist may make it hard to wear fit you've got a pooch around the belly.

Great dress! It is much brighter than the RTR photos, but I like it. Fabric is fabulous to look put together in a hotter climate. I have long arms, and the sleeves are a bit shorter than my preference, so this should work well for petites also.
Fit perfectly, exactly my style - a polished boho. I bought it.

links_reviews_title: Perfect fit! Can be worn for a variety of occasions
links_reviews_text: Fits so well, one of my favorite rentals!
I'm 5'8" and have hips, ~145lbs. This dress was amazing and so comfortable! I wanted to wear it to work, too!

I was on the fence about renting this dress because it didn't look like anything too special but am SO glad I did because I loved it! It fit like a glove and made me feel so feminine and ladylike. It runs true to size for higher end brands, but size up if between sizes. I'm usually a 6 in saloni but wear a 4 in many other brands.
Fit perfectly, very figure flattering even with so much print on my small frame. I loved wearing this flowy dress
Perfect / easy fit.

links_reviews_title: This dress is so beautifully tailored and gives your body a sleek contour!
links_reviews_text: I really liked the way this dress fit. It was highly flattering and the material flows beautifully! I have 21-month twins, and one of the days we were double-booked with parties and I wore this dress: I was very comfortable, looked polished, and got so many compliments! It was casual, yet dressy and easy to work with so I could easily keep track of the kids.

I'd admired this on someone else at a wedding and couldn't wait to rent it for a Rehearsal Dinner, but it didn't quite look the same on me -- the shoulders seemed awkwardly poofy for my frame and the dress was a tad long for my taste (I'm 5'5" and it looked ill-fitting I think). I still wore it (didn't really have other options) but don't think I'd rent this one again.
not forgiving in the waist but very pretty

This dress is so beautiful- I really didn't want to return it. Light and flowing, beautiful pattern and a nice sway. Romantic, feminine and chic! I wore this for family pictures and it photographed beautifully. The only draw back is that if you have long arms, as I do, the sleeve are a bit too short making the button cuffs a bit uncomfortable.

Fit true to size for mean. I have been between a 10 and 12 lately and this in 10 was perfect. Top is forgiving, waistband is a little tight when sitting but actually made me look slimmer when standing. Great for a cocktail party event!

I loved this dress! It's super modest, and that combined with the print made me worry it would be frumpy, but it's just not - the fitted midsection and sheer sleeves and gorgeous fabric just make it beautiful. I feel like it can be dressed up or dressed down - you wouldn't feel underdressed for an event in it, but it's not too much for work or everyday - so it's really just an easy lovely dress.
Beautiful flowey dress. Weist runs a bit small
I got so many compliments wearing this dress. It was comfortable and beautiful. Lightweight enough for Florida summer.
I don't think I'll be giving this lady back for awhile. I wore it for a work conference and it was a hit! Not to mention the perfect light weight work appropriate summer dress.
Great fitting pants. No weird gap in the back--hugs your waist perfectly. Great substitute for jeans.

links_reviews_title: These are so fun and fit great! I ended up purchasing them because I wore them so much! LOVE!!
links_reviews_text: True to size, very little stretch to the denim
These really get the job done. Have worn them a bunch. They run big, especially in the crotch/thigh. Recommend sizing down. They're the perfect ankle length and they're nice and slim in the calf.
Pants fit great true to size. Only thing I didn't like is that the camo print wasn't as strong as the picture looks.
This is a great subtle camo print that offers some visual interest without being loud and aggressive. The fit is true to size.

links_reviews_title: The fit was great, especially if you have wide hips.
links_reviews_text: Loved the subtle camo pattern. If you were just glancing they seem like all green jeans.

Wore these a few times. They fit like a glove and were the perfect length (a nice crop on me even though I'm short). The camo pattern was pretty much not visible though, definitely different from the photos. Not sure if that was from wear or if that's just how they are.
These were an odd length on me - way too short to look cute. Plus they were kind of baggy in the legs and overall unflattering. I didn't wear them. I thought the subtle camo pattern was cute though.

These are cute. I'm pear shaped and heavier in my legs. These were form fitting all down the leg, even the calf, but a little loose in the waist for me. The camo fabric and color are great. High quality item.
Fit like a glove. High waist, skinny. Length is a above ankles. Perfect for low boots. Lots of compliments.
Fit great!
Impressed with the fit and versatility of the camo print for casual or dressy casual wear. Not too much camo...just the right amount.

I loved these. I wish I had a good picture. I sized up to be safe and was happy I did. They were pretty stiff but they also still had the tags on! They did relax a bit as the day went on. I think as they're worn more theyll be truer to size. Not as high waisted as I would have liked (hit just below my belly button). Length was perfect on me. The camo print is way more subtle than in the photo. I wore with a light pink shirt and jean jacket.

links_reviews_title: nice casual goes with a lot of tops in my closet
links_reviews_text: I liked the shorter length so easy with boots or tennis shoes, goes with almost everything in my closet. Very comfortable

links_reviews_title: I have always wanted to try camp pants.
links_reviews_text: The green was too faded for me. I also like longer lengths since I am tall.
I wore these both for work and date night in Valentine's Day. They were a lot smaller than I thought they would be, but I loved them and didn't even notice they were on me- in a good way!

links_reviews_title: Cute earrings for WFH, but nothing special
links_reviews_text: These kate spade hearts earrings were cute, but unmemorable. The pink and red earrings are true to color, though smaller than I expected, and extremely light. They came with earring backs, which was nice, so I did not have to pilfer backs from my stash of earrings. I rented these for WFH and errands and they looked cute with an athleisure outfit. However, they were nothing special, in my opinion. I only wore them once before returning.

links_reviews_title: I brought these on a trip to Mexico!
links_reviews_text: Super cute, lightweight, and exactly as pictured.
This shirt is easy to wear, I put a cardigan over it and it was a comfortable, good looking outfit
I liked the print and the neck tie, just wish it was cut a little more flattering.
Loved the colors and print! Nice light material, good for work or just casual wear. Got a few compliments as well!

I liked this top a lot. I usually wear low necklines, so this was a bit of a change for me, but it was fine. I wore it with some casual pants, but you could also dress this up with a skirt or some nice shorts and heels. I would say this shirt felt like a size small, not an extra small. I ordered at size 2, but it felt more like a size 4 to me.

links_reviews_title: Classic blouse for work, comfy and cute!
links_reviews_text: Light weight, matches a lot of suits, really comfortable, lots of compliments!!
Great fit... great print... perfect for day out or work
Comfortable with right amount of color
I needed a blouse. This is a blouse :) I wanted this to be a knockout on me but it's just okay. Fit is fine but it's just okay. Probably better on a taller person.

This is a nice top as it goes with black, navy, olive, tan, white. It leans a little more conservative than I usually prefer but the colors are pretty for spring without being too loud. I wouldn't rent again but wore it a couple times. The lines in it are a dark navy.

links_reviews_title: Nice top! I wore it to work.
links_reviews_text: I am heavy on top so runs slightly small. Overall nice top.

links_reviews_title: Looked great with a navy blazer
links_reviews_text: Loved that this looked feminine but still work appropriate/not too cutesy. The navy detailing looked beautiful under a navy blazer. And, because there aren't any buttons to worry about, there was no gaping.

links_reviews_title: Could be dressed up or down.
links_reviews_text: I really wanted to like this one but the ties always get me and never look right on me. I feel this one made me look like something my grandmother would wear.

I normally wear a L/XL 14/16 and RTR suggested I wear this shirt in a 14 - it was way too small in the waist and bust. I had to ship it back right away. Had it fit properly I would have worn it to work as it was a cute top.
Love the print, nice silk. Fit is loose. More of a summer top but I wore to work in winter with a cardigan over it.
Beautiful fit, tailored and chic

links_reviews_title: Love the colors and the fit.
links_reviews_text: It fit well and I worn it with jeans and to work. Very versatile.

links_reviews_title: Beautiful blouse. Perfect for every day or a date night.
links_reviews_text: Fits as described
A little tighter than expected, but still tuck-in friendly - went great with a pair of navy blue ankle pants.
Good flow, nice fabric
Was a little long on me but a 5' 1" so that is pretty typical. Still looked nice with a pencil midi-skirt in navy.
