I absolutely loved this dress for super professional vibes. It's a little heavy and longer than I expected, but it's so comfortable and flattering. No buttons, no zippers, no fuss - just put it on and be ready to take over the world. I probably could've sized down, it was a little big in the midsection.
Polished look. Fits incredibly well. Conservative for work.
This was great for work - I wore it to an important meeting and got a lot of compliments. I wish I sized down as it was a bit big.

Nice cut and weight on this sweater dress. It looks really professional, doesn't wrinkle, and has an interesting look. My only complaint was that the colors seem muted, like it was an older dress even though it was a new arrival.
Great fit, bright colors, light weight beautiful built in waist line belt.
I really loved this dress. It's well made, the colors are great, and there's something about the way the waist falls that is incredibly flattering. Excellent rental!

links_reviews_title: The actual dress is much better than the picture
links_reviews_text: Very thick and comfortable to wear. The actual dress fits nicely and looks so much better than the picture. If you want something that can be dressed up, but also something comfortable at the same time, this is the right dress.

links_reviews_title: it fits perfectly , sizing is great and so luxurious
links_reviews_text: great length I am tall so this was great for me I love it and would buy it.
Comfortable, true to size, and good quality fabric. Wore it to work.
I love this dress!! I've rented it twice and received lots of complements both times. Very flattering, unique and comfortable. I highly recommend

links_reviews_title: I love this dress! Will rent again.
links_reviews_text: Heavy material makes this dress very forgiving and flattering! I have worn this to work a few times - I will rent this again.
It was very form fitting but a little long. I did get a lot of compliments.
A bit fitted around the waist...if you prefer loose around waist then go up one size.
Pretty dress but heavy knit. Couldn't wear in CA climate so didn't wear it.
good dress for winter/ Fall

This is a heavy material that worked really well for work on a cool, drizzly day. The vertical stripes made this flattering to my curvy shape. I wore this dress with fleece tights and wedges for a regular work day in a law firm.
Decent work dress. Added a belt to give it some shape. I am a 4/6, the 4 had plenty of room. I am certain the 6 would have been too big.
I layered this for a cooler winter but wish I could use a black turtleneck. Either way can be worn year round.

Nice everyday dress. Order at least one size down . I'm usually a 4 - 135 IBS, 27 waist and this was too big everywhere . Print is a very mod 50s design Of abstract squares. If that is your thing, it almost looked like flowers on the website so I was surprised when I received it

links_reviews_title: Love this so much for work and going out after work

links_reviews_text: This fit great. Had a cute retro vibe. I'm a 6/8, and the 6 fit perfectly/ maybe a tad loose. Loved the funky print.

I loved this dress and felt very pretty in it. It wore it with flats, and then another day with tights and boots. My favorite part was the length, as it falls right to the knee, which looks so elegant. I'm a pear and the way it narrows at the waist and flares a bit at the hips is very flattering. I'm normally a 2 or sometimes a 0 in dresses. In this dress I wore a 0 and it actually had a bit of extra fabric, although not in a way that others could tell; I think a 00 would have even fit. I got compliments on its "retro" vibe. I would definitely rent again and maybe even buy. The chest wasn't revealing at all so it would be a great piece for work.

The fit on this was nice & comfortable- easy to transition from work w motorcyle boots to everyday wear ( I paired mine w some strap it flat sandals & jean jacket). I suspect this would be harder to wear for gals on the shorter side, unless worn with heels. I did think it would be a bit of a lighter fabric, just to keep in mind- it is fully lined.
Perfect length and style for work. Got my regular size but maybe could have sized down for a little tighter fit.
Great, easy dress but runs large. I'm usually between 2 and a 4 and needed to belt this one. Next time will get a 2
Fit really well. Super comfortable.

Very cute! The neckline is fixed, so it doesn't show cleavage. Take that as a pro or a con, depending on your taste. The sides came up high enough that I didn't have to worry about my bra being visible on the sides.
Pros: Fitted my curves perfectly without over doing it. Nice material, cool print. Cons: None.
I thought this was a really stylish and work appropriate outfit. My one feedback is that the top runs a bit large to I had some extra room. I would not buy this on my own but good for a rental.

links_reviews_title: Will rent again for office holiday party
links_reviews_text: Feminine drapey fit but good for work. I'm going to rent again for our office holiday party next month for sure. I'm 5'4" and it hit right at my knee. Good for taller ladies, but potentially too long for very petite women.

links_reviews_title: Dress has great top design and is surprisingly flattering on the hips
links_reviews_text: Didn't think this was going to be a winner, but sure was! The top design is soooo flattering with v neck etc, and the cut is actually flattering on the hips - a well made dress! I wore boots for a fall look, but also going to wear with heels to work

links_reviews_title: Perfect for the office in any season. I wore it with tights and booties and it is an easy wear.
links_reviews_text: Easy and patterned, but still quite traditional.
Warm enough for a cool, but not freezing day. 3/4 sleeves and a lack of fastener or buttons make this more a layering item than a winter coat. Nicely constructed and hangs beautifully.
Love this blazer. Looks great while keeping you warm. Extra bonus for the pockets!
I expected this coat to be thicker than it was, I ended up making it apart of my outfit and wearing a true coat on top of it.
This jacket was the perfect pop of color for my rehearsal dinner outfit. It did keep me warm, although has no button in the front and sleeves are cropped. Perfect for my needs and would rent again.

links_reviews_title: Perfect blend of comfort and style!
links_reviews_text: Wore this for my engagement photos. Loved the thick and stretchy fabric. Ran a little big overall but loved the cut and color!
Perfect color!! size down.
I liked this for a fall day that wasn't too cold. The shorter sleeves worked well.

I rented this for something to wear over my wedding dress in case of cool weather and ended up wearing it everyday. It lays open so it's not for very cold weather but is beautiful. I was sad it was too expensive to buy.

This burgundy coat was beautiful...doesn't wrinkle, classic fit too. You need your own belt to wear with it if you want it closed as it doesn't have any buttons or belt. Loved the color and fabric. 3/4 length sleeves which was fun...it shows off your long sleeve. Keeps you warm for 45 degrees or above, but. It meant for true winter. Loved it!! I used to live in Texas and it would be my ideal winter coat for a more moderate climate city. Great Fall coat for us Northerners!
Love this overcoat! The material felt such luxurious and was super warm & heavy while still completely moveable and comfortable. Plenty of room for layering. No complaints!!

links_reviews_title: Gorgeous color and coat for those quick occasions where you're outside
links_reviews_text: The color on this jacket is wonderful for fall and winter. The jacket itself isn't very warm, but it's just enough to throw on over a dress and run from your car to an event. It runs very roomy.

I am 5'4" and this coat is essentially reached my ankles. The length with the oversized shape made it look like a house coat on me. I wouldn't rent again and I didn't wear it, but I would recommend to size down *at least* two sizes. Color was also a bit darker than I expected.
This coat is a gorgeous wine color and really nice fabric. The fit is supposed to be baggy, and I thought it was perfect.

links_reviews_title: Was the perfect jacket to wear over a dress to a work event.
links_reviews_text: It was a little long for my taste, but it still worked!

links_reviews_title: I received so many compliments . This is a great color
links_reviews_text: great fit!

links_reviews_title: Loved it with the Cole Haan burgundy tote!
links_reviews_text: No way to close the coat, so not super warm. I wore it with scarves and gloves and was fine. Looked brand new, awesome on-trend color.

links_reviews_title: Amazing color, unflattering fit for a short woman
links_reviews_text: This coat is a gorgeous color, but was shapeless and big, which, for a petite woman, unfortunately was not flattering. The coat was practically down to my ankles, and would look cuter if left to drape open. I'm in a colder city and needed to be able to wear it closed, but it just was too big and bulky to look cute on my. Love the color though!

I wish I could keep this! It's an absolutely gorgeous coat--lightweight but warm enough to throw over a lot of different outfits to add a bit of polish. It does run a little large and has an intentionally boxy fit, so you can comfortably go down 1 or even 2 sizes for a more figure-skimming look.

I loved this coat and got tons of compliments in it, but it's not practical as there is no closure on it. A small hidden hook would have made this a keeper. It was a great duster for a conference where I didn't need to worry about keeping it closed, but walking outside I was constantly pulling it together to stay covered.

I waited for this to become available to rent it and was so excited when it did. But I ended up not wearing it. Sized up since I'm 32 weeks pregnant and definitely didn't need to - it swallowed me up and didn't look flattering. In fact, I'd probably go down two sizes. I may try it again after the baby is born so I can wear heels with it (it was also SUPER long on me - I'm 5'3") because I love the color / look. It's a nice weight for norcal's mild Fall weather.

links_reviews_title: I get compliments on this coat daily.
links_reviews_text: Nice lighter weight winter jacket. Loved the color, fit, length, and easy style. Matches most everything I wear.

I missed having a button to keep this closed. But it is a gorgeous color that goes with everything. A good length too and nice fabric. There is a dress that matches but I work it more as a fall overcoat.

links_reviews_title: Simple but very elegant lightweight overcoat.
links_reviews_text: Great for adding a little warmth, true to size and able to fit over a blazer or sweater underneath. Pockets are really low, so it's a little hard to reach things in them but at least they are there are functional!

links_reviews_title: Rented this for everyday use in the fall
links_reviews_text: I LOVE IT!! Very well made coat and I can dress it up or down. Wish I could keep it.
Will hang on to this beauty for a while. Fabulous color and construction, perfect fall piece, and versatile!
I rented this for a wedding in early fall. It was the perfect weight and so well made. I ordered a size up since I figured I could make it work. However: I should have stayed with a size medium.

links_reviews_title: Run very small so order up!
links_reviews_text: I wore this for a Christmas party and it was perfect with black tights and boots. I am 5'3" and currently 130 pounds and I had to wear the size large to be comfortable in it. It is really tight fitting! I'm normally a small or xs and not sure what is with the sizing on this. I had read other reviews that said to size up so I got a medium and large so do the same!
Wore this on a business trip: all day meeting and a cocktail party. I usually wear a small and the medium was a snug fit, so sizing definitely runs on the small side.
The ruffle detail at the bottom of the skirt made it fun and cute and the neckline, sleeves and length made it work appropriate!

I listened to the comments and sized up to a medium. Slate and Willow I'm usually a small without issue- about a 4 usually potentially a 2 but even a medium in this dress was tight in the arms and the rib cage.and I'm only a 34 back size B bra size. I probably could have even gone to a large. Loved anyway got tons of compliments-- would definitely rent again but would size up to a large

Totally cute dress for work. Absolutely runs small so size up (I normally wear a 4-6 and the L was juuuust cutting it on this one). The arms and bust are definitely tight, but the material is forgiving enough that it works. Could be a little short for some but worked for me at 5'4"!

My measurements are 33-26-35, and the XS fit me like a glove -- a tiny bit tight but I think that's how it's supposed to fit. The material is stretchy, I felt a little constrained but I wasn't worried it was going to bust at the seams or anything like that. I don't think this size would work for anyone bigger than a 26in waist though. If you have broad or athletic shoulders I recommend sizing up. The black laser-cut out part is attached to a light gray netting, and the whole dress (except the sleeves) is lined in black. It's hard to tell in the RtR pics, so I took a close-up pic of the material with a white paper behind it. The netting isn't itchy, but it's noticeably not soft. The length is good for work, it rides up a little when I sit as most dresses do, but I wasn't afraid to bend over to open a file drawer or anything. Overall a cute fun dress for work, loses 1 star for the minor discomforts of being tight-fitting and not soft.

links_reviews_title: Once you see it, you can't unsee it
links_reviews_text: I really wanted to love this dress. It's a great design in theory, but the execution is poor. Like other reviewers noted, this runs very small. I am a true size 4 and sized up to a medium. The other issue I had is that the pattern is off center in both the top half and the skirt (see photo). Once I noticed this, it kept bothering me. I checked the photo of the model to see if this was intentional, but the dress on RTR's model shows a symmetrical pattern and a perfectly matched top and bottom half, making my uneven pattern even more irritating. This seems like a quality control issue that the designer could easily have corrected. Disappointing.

links_reviews_title: Nice work dress, runs small. Great length for short girls!
links_reviews_text: I wanted to be obsessed with this dress, but I just liked it, and maybe that's because it'd be a great work dress and I'm now an RN and only wear scrubs. Pros: I'm 5'2" and it's hard finding good mid-length dresses; this hits right above the knee for me and looks perfect! Also the cutout pattern is super cool, and it looks very chic. Cons: the fabric is on the heavier side but is not the most flattering. I'm a size 6-8 hips and 4-6 waist, it didn't really do much to show off my figure. Also definitely runs small as I got the large based on other reviews, I think a medium would've been too tight. Also not sure how it'd fit on a larger chest. Overall it really is a super cute dress, I just don't think it's cut for my shape or my preference for fit.
You'll need help zipping it up!
I loved this dress and received many compliments. Great work to evening dress! Runs a little small, but not enough to size up.

links_reviews_title: Cute but not the most comfortable
links_reviews_text: It's a cute dress, but the zipper gets stuck very easily and the inner lining isn't the most comfortable. Maybe sizing up would help.

links_reviews_title: Very cute for a night out or work!
links_reviews_text: Super cute dress! I really loved the pattern was a little tight but material is stretchy so easily could zip it up. Overall loved this dress, would rent again

links_reviews_title: Cute dress; runs REALLY small. I ordered a size up, but the large did not fit that great.
links_reviews_text: #workwear

I love this trendy dress by Slate & Willow! Running true to size with no stretch, I recommend wearing your true size for your primary size and going up for your back up. This style is fitted throughout the midsection and loose at the hips. It works for cup sizes A-C. You are able to wear a standard bra with this dress. At 5’4”, the length hit mid-thigh on me. I recommend wearing tights so this dress can go from business casual to happy hour! The pattern on the dress is amazing in person and makes it a very unique piece. Pair with black heels and fun earrings to complete your outfit!

links_reviews_title: It was cute! Wish it fit.
links_reviews_text: Wayyyyyyy small. I wear xs in a lot of brands, but this was teeny.

links_reviews_title: The dress itself is very beautiful. The patchwork is even more beautiful in person than in the photo
links_reviews_text: This is my fault but I assumed that an XS would fit me correctly. I couldn't even get into the dress. I'm 5'1 and weight around 100lbs. I don't know who would fit into an XS to be honest. The dress itself is absolutely beautiful and would have loved to wear it.

links_reviews_title: Loved the style but too small

links_reviews_text: Runs small I didn't wear it
The Dress is beautiful but runs one whole size small... i couldnt wear it because of how tight it was. But of you order this one size up you will love it!
Too small even though sized up one size and the zipper was broken and wouldn't zip up past the half way seam.
Glad I took the advise of other reviewers and sized up! Unique dress but still work appropriate. I wore with a jacket and booties. Lots of Compliments!

links_reviews_title: Cute dress but runs smaller than recommended.
links_reviews_text: I rented this dress for work. It's nice looking. It is more fitted in the hips and runs small for a large.

links_reviews_title: Loved loved loved this dress - rocked it w/ riding boots and owned the outfit.
links_reviews_text: Short but not too short for work. True to size. It just screams quality. There are a few textiles at work that the photo just doesn't highlight well enough. Its a gorgeous dress. Wear it with boots and it works for fall/winter.
I ordered a small and couldn't zip it up. I really want to wear this but need the next size. It's not available right now so when it is I will reorder it a size larger.
I normally wear a 0-2 and this dress I couldn't even zip up!

I am normally between a XS and S. Could not zip up the small, returning without wearing. Not ordering the M because I don't think the top part will be flattering on me even if could zip it up. Maybe not meant for girls with larger chests. However length was just right for petite.

links_reviews_title: Didn't fit and too short for work

links_reviews_text: Runs small
Medium is my normal size but this dress was way too tight.
I am Typically a size 8 and this medium was sized to fit a size 4. Just beware. So pretty, I wish it did fit
Runs extremely small!

links_reviews_title: Cute dress but Medium is More Like Small
links_reviews_text: Their dress has a great pattern and I would have like to wear but the medium size was more like a small. It was cut very narrow in the back and arms. It was also a little to short for work.
I am usually a small but I saw this ran small so ordered a medium, even that was too small

I listened to the reviews and ordered a size up, L. I am normally a small - medium so I assumed the large would fit. It did not fit at all! I couldn't even get it zipped halfway. For reference I am 5'2 - 135lbs - 32DDD. It's a beautiful dress but runs very, very small.
I usually wear a 0/2 or XS and the Medium in this dress was fitted on me! The neck is high and a bit irritating. Cute dress, but nothing comfy or special.
It's was tight in mid section, so would size up, but detailing and style were nice.
amazing dress, tons compliments
Super cute dress but realized after it shipped that I ordered it in the wrong size.
I typically wear a size 4, sometimes a 6. I couldn't even get the M over my hips. It was cute and well-made, but wholly unwearable.

links_reviews_title: Cute but stretch out after 1 wear
links_reviews_text: Wore these to work. Cute look with a long tunic and I liked the cropped length. Downside was they stretched out a lot after just 1 wear, particularly around the waist. Good thickness to the material and not see through.
I tried them on and liked how they fit. Unfortunately it's just too darn hot to wear jeans. I'll rent them when it gets cooler.
The pant fit great--perfect length, high enough in the rise.
A little too loose
a little thicker so they are more flattering

great pants! I'm 5'3 and they hit mid-rise. The waist could have been smaller but since I've got pretty thick thighs, I'm glad I went with the 31s. I have early-aughts jean fit trauma (none of the cool brands my friends wore went big enough) so after 15 years, I was very excited to fit into these!

links_reviews_title: My thighs laughed at these jeans!
links_reviews_text: I couldn't even pull these up past my knees. When they say skinny, they really mean it.
Wore these on my day trip to Stonehenge and they were perfect.
Cute pants. Love the crop.
great fit, love these jeans!

links_reviews_title: Cute but large around the waist
links_reviews_text: These pants are tight fitting around the legs but had a huge gap in the waist so I was constantly pulling them up.
I should have ordered a size down, these run a little big.

Really enjoyed these. A good basic, casual, white jean. Maybe a little on the big side but I think the fit is meant to be slightly relaxed, not a "super skinny" fit. If you like a very fitted look, maybe size down but otherwise true to size. I wore them a couple times and seemed to hold their shape well. Not see-thru. Considered buying them but didn't think they were special enough to justify spending that much on another pair of white jeans.

links_reviews_title: Great white jean, not too tight, heavy enough material.
links_reviews_text: Loved them!

links_reviews_title: If you have slim legs, the ankles will look loose. Not a toothpick kinda pant
links_reviews_text: Fit comfortable up top, stretchy fabric but past the knees it flooded. Not the best fit.
really comfortable and fit perfectly

I love citizens! Good quality, not super see through, flattering, good fit on waist:hips:thighs. I didn't wear these because the ankle flared out too much on me. I'm 5'6 with super skinny ankles and the length hit right above my ankle but the amount of flare made it look like I was wearing full length pants that shrunk. These might look great if you have a larger ankle or you're shorter and can wear them full length

links_reviews_title: Fun and easy for my Coronacation
links_reviews_text: I wore this a few times working for home and BBQing with the family. It runs a little short. I might try a L next time, but would worry a bit about the length. Was great with higher waisted white jeans.
Doing RTR unlimited and decided to add some shirts to the mix. The poofy shoulder was big but fun for a 1 or 2 time wear. Wrinkles easily but overall got a few compliments!
I liked the interesting diagonals in the stripes and the creative button-front cut. Body length was inadequate for me at 5'11" so layering over a tank was required.
This shirt is easy to wear and versatile. It marries a classic French blue/white stripe shirt but with a fun cut. It's not super crisp, but still look professional and fun. Can be dressed up or down.

links_reviews_title: Cute take on a classic button down
links_reviews_text: This is a great summer work shirt. It's light and flattering. Look best slightly tucked in, otherwise it puffs out a bit too much for my taste.

Great summer vibes and light material. Slightly more rustic/relaxed look than the model photo shows. Would be very cute with white jeans but I'm a little early to pair them. The sleeves are a little puffier than I thought - size up to make sure they aren't too tight and can hang down to reduce the puffiness.

links_reviews_title: Would be cute with white jeans
links_reviews_text: Cute, grayish blue stripes. Would look good with white jeans
The fit is different and the cut is flattering. I wore the top many times to work and on the weekend. Versatile. Would highly recommend.

I wore it to work with black skinny pants and to an Easter egg hunt with cropped jeans. I loved it! True to size, maybe a little big. I usually have a hard time with button ups with my large chest and this was fine.

links_reviews_title: Not for those who like symmetry
links_reviews_text: Because I'm short in height and waist, I like symmetrical clothing. The cross over made me look shorter so I didn't like it. Otherwise well made. Stretchy in a good make-room-for-your -body kind of way.
Loved this top. Very unique cut and style. Fit well. Looked best tucked into high waisted jeans or skirt
The top was cute and just borderline too tight at the cuffs, but I decided it just wasn't comfortable and didn't end up wearing it out of the house.
The fit was super comfortable but a bit boxy for my frame.
comfy & cute

links_reviews_title: can wear for work or everyday
links_reviews_text: With the puffy sleeves with tight jeans it looks really good.
Fit great, just too puffy in the sleeves for my liking. I didn't end up wearing
Love this top! I wore it a couple of times with white jeans and got lots of compliments. The wrap style and stripes makes the whole outfit!

links_reviews_title: If you have a long torso don't forget the cami underneath
links_reviews_text: I wore this shirt for a casual work day. The button detail was very cute but if you have a long torso this shirt would be way too short! Overall not worth the rental. No wow factor.
Loved this shirt. Got lots of compliments. Nice enough for work but can be worn casually. Different but not weird. Fits great! Comfortable.

This is an interesting play on the typical collared, striped, shirt. The fit was spot on and the fabric is completely comfortable. It wrinkles but doesn't look overly bad when it does. Length was great on me and longish short sleeves were a plus in summer working in AC but still comfortable outside. Can skew slightly matronly depending on your age, especially with a bigger bust.

This looked great with white jeans! It was comfortable but the sleeves were much puffier than the picture shows. When I raised my arms above waist high, they poofed out like Snow White's sleeves. Loved the neckline and the diagonal striping but i wouldn't rent again.

links_reviews_title: Wore this shirt several times so great
links_reviews_text: Rent it! Great top
This shirt fits true to size, but the sleeves were just a little too theatrical for me. Didn't end up wearing. If I were a bit more flamboyant, I totally would!
Good for those who are large on top but runs a little large and wrinkles easy.
nice fit, a little too short if you want to tuck it in your jeans.

This is the perfect summer blouse. It was easy to dress up for work or pair with shorts for a preppy summer weekend look. I received lots of compliments on this top. Very flattering. The sleeves were puffy without being too big.
The extra fabric had a balloon effect. It wouldn't flatten. Like at all. I mixed feelings about it. Wanted to like it but couldn't get over the balloon arms. Did not wear it out.
I did not like how I looked in this shirt. I never ended up wearing it. I felt constricted and it felt short. I have a large busy so maybe this would work for someone with a smaller chest.

Runs a little big but not enough to say it runs large, it's just a loose fit. If you're looking for something more fitted, this isn't it - but it's super cute, wore it on Saturday with boyfriend jeans.

I think this top would be lovely on a person with narrow shoulders. The puffed sleeves are voluminous and made me look unbalanced. I feel like it made my head look abnormally small. The fabric was nice and I loved the diagonal enclosure. If the sleeves were not so ginormous, I would have really liked this one.

links_reviews_title: The top was way too big.
links_reviews_text: Too big.
Great fitting

links_reviews_title: very roomy fit but VERY SHORT
links_reviews_text: Very short..I don't understand why this designer's shirts are always so short
The fit was as expected except the shirt was too short to be flattering, so I ultimately didn't wear it. If you have a shorter torso, I'd highly recommend.
I love this blouse. It fit like a glove and was not too plunging like many of the tops on RTR.
The sleeves are very puffy - but I loved wearing this for an outdoor puppy and frozé meeting at a cafe.
Top is super cute - nice/well-made material, and love the puff sleeves. However, size at least one or two sizes up! I sized up once from my usual size, but still returning for the next size up.
Slimming, hides imperfections well. Fits beautifully. Not too tight or too loose.

links_reviews_title: So flattering on my postpartum tummy!
links_reviews_text: I felt so confident in this! The sleeves were strange and big, but the wrap detail was very adjustable and I am not as thin as I looked in this photo! I got so many compliments at the work holiday party, even having no sitter last minute!
Loved this dress. I wore it to work and everyone wanted to know where I got it. It fits beautifully and looks sleek and sophisticated. It would be great to wear out for a date or other festive event.

I fluctuate between a 6 & and 8 - I have an hourglass figure and this was tight in the hips for me. The material is nice and the long tie elongates the figure, but beware that it's a little more orange than appears in the pic.
Cute dress. Had to be creative with the tie in front, but overall loved it.
So beautiful, it can be tied several different ways, I wrapped it around twice to make a smaller bow. So many compliments, will rent again!

I had hoped to wear this for an awards ceremony, but the fit and design were just too odd. I swam in it - could solve the tie problem by doubling it around, but the sleeves were too long and it was ultimately unwearable. Also too orange of a red for my skin tone.
Loved the color, but the proportions were tough on me. Sleeves were too long and so was the tie, but tied in a bow felt awkward. Better on a teller frame.

This dress was amazing! While the structure is simple the bow adds a fun detail to make it unique. It's a bit on the thicker side so it was a bit hot for the summer day I wore it on. Definitely a must rent!

I received so many compliments in this dress. I loved the way it looks and feels. I have an athletic build with a nice size butt and this dress was a little restricting in the arms and the butt area. I would go one size up to have a little more freedom. Overall loved the dress.

links_reviews_title: A little tight across my shoulders Otherwise loved it
links_reviews_text: Looks classy

links_reviews_title: Vibrant Red Dress // 24wks Pregnant // great for cocktail or formal affairs
links_reviews_text: Runs large. Wore sz4 when 5'2/125/32DDD and 24 wks pregnant. It was a touch tight around the bra line/rib cage but otherwise was a forgiving fit. The top of dress allowed space for a large bust. The front ties were long but not cumbersome. Sleeves were long, though you can fold them up. They won't stay folded but it helps while eating, etc.
This dress makes you feel fab! Arms are slightly tight so I would size up if you've got bigger arms - shouldn't affect the fit of the dress. Highly recommend!

links_reviews_title: This is the perfect dress for a work cocktail party!
links_reviews_text: Fit is TTS and the ties in front let you adjust the bust a bit. The dress is lined but it's thin material so Spanx are a must if you have any lumpy bits.
Great color. Likely too dressy if not in a more formal workplace. But great dress and good for tall gals

I wore this to a business luncheon and the compliments wouldn't stop. I felt elegant and classy and am glad I chose this dress. The bow belt my be too long for a shorter woman so be careful not to trip. All pro for me...no cons.

I rented this for a Corporate work training and it fits like a glove! A little tight in the upper part but I am super broad so that's to be expected. Honestly considering keeping it for a wedding I'm attending in a few weeks!

Perfect color, perfect fit, great design! I love this dress. So many compliments. You will stand out in any room. Fits true to size and plenty of room for your tatas. Beautiful color, would rent again!

Great look during colder weather. The color was orange-red so it was unique. Cut was so flattering, I loved that the bow basically hid any tummy issues. Got a ton of compliments in this dress and felt great all day.
Loved this dress! The color drew a lot of attention but it was all positive. The tie stings are super long, so I recommend this for taller folks. I almost bought this dress I liked it so much.

Great dress and STILL receiving COMPLIMENTS! This dress hugged all the right places, was light and airy, but did not show everything (that being said you CAN see a panty line, so dress accordingly)! Loved the color and I love sleeves and these sleeves were FUN as they are meant to drape down your hands, which gives a great retro feel! I wore this for a speaking engagement and didn't want the day to end!! Enjoy, this one makes you feel giddy and special!
Would rent again. Wrapped around twice for work. Long ribbon in front is so cute but not efficient for the office.

It's cute-ish, and comfortable. The color is fantastic. The tie is... not great. I tried to tie it in a bow to make the length not trip-able but it untied nearly immediately after the one photo I took and at 5'7", it was still a battle of not tripping over it when I wore it the two times I did. If the tie would've been shorter, it would've been super cute and a lovely casual dress to wear, but because of that, it definitely isn't a favorite rental of mine and I won't be renting it again and I wore it barely at all comparing how often I wear pieces I love before returning them. It definitely runs large in comparison to other dresses on this site, so I would say size down if you're in between sizes like I am!

I love the color and the shape of this dress, and would consider wearing it if it weren't for the incredibly long tie. In flat shoes it drags on the ground and in heels I'm guaranteed to still trip on it. Nice shape to the dress and fabric has a nice drape. Might be better for ladies over 6'

links_reviews_title: Not a true red and I love it!
links_reviews_text: I love this dress! It's simple, sophisticated and chic. Perfect work dress for the office or any professional setting. It was loose in the right places and still hugged three right curves. I would reccomend this dress for all body types. The color is perfect as well and I think pairs with other colors just perfectly or even patterns since it's a solid color. I felt comfortable all day yet stylish. I even had a lady tell me she really needed to have this dress. I know the pictures do not give it justice as it's a dress you must wear to truly appreciate! Check out other videos and outfits I've rented from rent the runway on my Instagram at @Mrs.chicchanel

This dress is so incredibly flattering. The color just pops and the details are luxe and fun. The fit is like a glove and it felt like it was made for my body. Truly felt like a million bucks in this!!

links_reviews_title: Lovely but runs smalls in bust
links_reviews_text: Lovely dress but it was a bit tight across the arms/bust. I decided not to wear for fear it might tear it just be uncomfortable all day. I think so I g up would've been too big everywhere else. So if you are busty I'd consider that when ordering the material does not stretch.
I had high hopes for this dress but not for me, the material was way to thin and clingy. Style is nice, color pretty.

links_reviews_title: Impossible to wear the ties down for a short person!
links_reviews_text: Ties are wayyyy too long. Dragging on floor.
A little small in hips

links_reviews_title: Proportions weren't good for a petite
links_reviews_text: Ran a bit small. Proportions were off for a shorter person

links_reviews_title: Sleeves were too long and the tie in the front kept coming undone
links_reviews_text: the top of this dress fit so different than the bottom. the cuts were not flattering for me around the shoulders, arms and armpits. I liked the color but that is about it.
sleeves are long
I didn't end up wearing bc didn't have the right under layer and the fabric isn't very forgiving (can see a lot). Would rent again with better planning.

links_reviews_title: Great dramatic sleeves and wonderful color.
links_reviews_text: The top was a bit snug and the upper waist bow made it hard to style. The hips were larger for me than the top of the dress ( I am slightly on the bustier side), and the lack of give in the fabric mad the dress unwearable based on the extra fabric in the hips. The hem hit at exactly the right spot and I would love to have worn it if the hips fit correctly.
The arms are tight so hard to move around. But the hips have too much room so that there is excess material.
Love, love, love! So many compliments
Love this dress. Fit perfect (perhaps large) on top and two sizes too small on bottom. Too bad.

I've worn this dress 4x now and gotten complimented by people i know AND random strangers every single time. Decided it was a keeper! The ties actually make the cut very flattering. The material is lined but not too heavy so it's versatile for warmer or cooler weather. The 6 was great for me to accent my waist but i did need help with zipping because the sleeves were restricting. Nonetheless, it's mine now and I'm so happy i got to "test drive" this dress before committing to it.

I have very muscular arms and shoulders, and in this dress I could not lift my arms. Additionally I have a large bust and this combined with the front bow was just not flattering. I did not wear it out of the house.

This shirt is amazing! It definitely needs a belt and, as you can see in the picture, if you're not y'all the front will slouch a little bit I still think it looks good with a belt. I wore this top with both a black belt and a tan belt with burnt orange crop flare corduroy pants and also wore it with black slacks. Can be dressed up or down. There are three interior buttons that hold this top closed so it will not blow open if you walk outside. A+ shirt

links_reviews_title: Great top, wear it two ways!
links_reviews_text: I loved this top and the cute pattern. wore it to work and got lots of compliments. If you keep it unbuttoned and open, it can look cute as a draped vest too! (See photo)

This is one of my favorite tops ever. It's sooo cute especially the pattern and fun buttons. However it's fairly complicated to get on right. Had to look at photos and get help from my partner lol. I think it Doesn't photograph as well as it looks in real life. Def recommend.

links_reviews_title: Not my typical style at all but trying to branch out and LOVED IT!!!!
links_reviews_text: The material felt very high quality and the way you button it takes a minute to do in the morning but overall loved this top! The high neck is something I would never do but was it was great and got soo many compliments!

Fabric and print are both great. It's very long and I didn't like it untucked but loved it tucked in. It wraps completely so getting it on is kind of tricky (there are 3 hidden buttons). Really great top though -- would be easy to dress down too! I would size down one if I ordered again.
I love this top. I got so many compliments on it. The fabric is really beautiful and you can tell the top is well-made
Great for work. Nice and flows yet looks professional with a jacket over

links_reviews_title: Very flattering sleeve and neck line.
links_reviews_text: Love this top!! Can be dressed up with a cape or down with jeans. I wore it to a baby sprinkle and a Christmas dinner.

links_reviews_title: don't wear this in the wind
links_reviews_text: there aren't a lot of buttons or hooks making this problematic if you wear it untucked in even the slightest gust of wind. yikes. 7/10 would rent again... and get a safety pin or three.
Loved the intricate details with this top. Fit great and was fun to wear.
Stunning. Perfect for work.
Super comfortable and great for layering and a work or event. Would rent again!

One of those "oh this is my jam" shirts that leads you to look at how much it would be to own and then spiral into a "well this is why i pay for the rental subscription" hole. But really, the pattern is super Cruela Devil sheik and the shirt just screams expensive. I got so many compliments and it just made me feel high class. 10/10 recommend.

links_reviews_title: This blouse was everything! Dress it up, dress it down!
links_reviews_text: It was a prefect fit, goes with jeans or black pants for dressing up for an event! Love it love it love!
